0.title: Michelin star chef Garima to join Vikas, Ranveer in 'MasterChef...': Reports
0.article_body: Michelin star chef Garima Arora is set to join 'MasterChef India 7' as a judge, as per reports. The 36-year-old chef is the first Indian woman to win a Michelin star. This is the first time that the show will have a female chef as a judge. Vikas Khanna and Ranveer Brar will also return as judges on the show.

1.title: Delhi boy wins Collins National Spelling Bee with word 'dialysis'
1.article_body: A Delhi boy, Madhav Kamath, has won the recently concluded Collins National Spelling Bee 2022 with the word 'dialysis'. Thousands of students participated in the competition which took place in Mumbai and the top 36 scorers reached the semi-final, out of which 12 competed against each other in the finale. The winner studies at Delhi's Sanskriti School.

2.title: Lies: Pawar on Maha govt's claims that Vedanta project moved to Guj under MVA
2.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar said Maharashtra government's claims that Vedanta-Foxconn decided to move their plant to Gujarat under Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government's rule are "complete lies". Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis also claimed that a "10% commission" had to be paid under MVA for every subsidy that was announced. "Let [BJP] probe, then things will be clear," Pawar added.

3.title: Man kills self after harassment over repayment of loan in Pune
3.article_body: A 52-year-old man allegedly ended his life on Monday after money lenders harassed him over the repayment of a loan in Pune. The deceased man's wife filed a complaint against seven persons, alleging that they charged exorbitant interest rates, harassed and threatened her husband. Meanwhile, police have booked seven persons under abetment to suicide and arrested four of them.

4.title: Poisoning young minds: BJP on Mufti's remark against hymn in school
4.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina on Tuesday accused Mehbooba Mufti of "poisoning young minds for vested political interests" over her objection to students reciting the 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' in schools in J&K. Mufti is coming out with such a conspiracy to regain her place after having lost her ground in J&K, Raina added.

5.title: Man sued in US for tipping waitress ₹2.3 lakh and then demanding it back
5.article_body: A US man is being sued by Pennsylvania's Alfredo's Pizza Cafe after he tipped a waitress $3,000 (₹2.3 lakh) and later demanded it back. He had challenged the tip with his credit card provider. The restaurant first assumed it was a miscommunication and made attempts to contact him but was unsuccessful. It later filed charges, describing the incident as "aggravating".

6.title: I don't drink or do drugs, but fame has intoxication: Ashneer on Shark Tank
6.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover while speaking about appearing as a judge on Shark Tank India, said, "I don't do drugs, I don't drink, I don't smoke. But fame has an intoxication. It gives you a high." He added, "And that...I can manage and I like." He also claimed that all the sharks came on the show to get famous.

7.title: Education should be in mother tongue: Minister Dharmendra Pradhan
7.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Monday stated that education should be imparted in one's mother tongue. Calling Tamil a national language, he added that the inclusion of Tamil in National Education Policy (NEP) would gradually gain support. He said that Tamil Nadu, which has a great heritage in education, will continue to lead the way in the framework of NEP.

8.title: Pro League will be helpful to prepare ourselves for hockey World Cup: Mandeep
8.article_body: Indian men's hockey team forward Mandeep Singh said the FIH Pro League, beginning October 28, will be helpful for the team to prepare for World Cup 2023. "It's always good to compete against strong teams before a major competition," he added. The World Cup is set to take place in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela from January 13 to 29, 2023.

9.title: 30% of Bharat Yatris are women; You're seeing new face of Cong: Jairam
9.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said that 30% of the "Yatris" in the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' are "women". "You're seeing a new face of the Congress. They are coming from different states," Ramesh said. He added, "Over 2 lakh people have registered...The Yatra is a tapasya for Rahul [Gandhi] Ji and public response has been in the form of bhakti."

10.title: Contractor to give ₹5 lakh aide to Noida wall collapse victims' relatives
10.article_body: The family members of the four labourers, who died after a boundary wall of a Noida housing society collapsed, will be provided ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each by the contractor, Noida Authority Chief Executive Officer Ritu Maheshwari said. Eight labourers were injured in the incident. Meanwhile, police detained a sub-contractor who supplied the labourers to repair drain in the society.

11.title: India to grow at over 7% in FY23, down from 8% projected in Jan: CEA
11.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on Tuesday said the Indian economy will grow at 7% in FY23, down from the 8-8.5% growth rate projected in January. He said the aftereffects of the COVID-19 pandemic and Russia's invasion of Ukraine are hurting economic growth. India is well-poised to sustain the 7% growth rate for remainder of the decade, he added.

12.title: 2 held for robbing man in Thane, using his credit cards to shop online
12.article_body: Thane Police arrested two persons for allegedly robbing a man of his belongings and using his credit cards to purchase items worth ₹1.6 lakh online, an official said. The incident took place on August 2 when the victim was going home and the accused threw spice powder at him and snatched his four mobile phones and credit cards, police said.

13.title: B'luru civic body extends application deadline for free laptops, housing subsidy
13.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has extended the last date to apply for welfare programmes, including a subsidy of ₹5 lakh for house construction on own plots, free laptops for students, smart sticks for blind persons, educational laptops for blind students and foldable wheelchairs for senior citizens to October 19. The original deadline to apply for the schemes was September 19.

14.title: US court reverses conviction of man in ex-girlfriend's murder case
14.article_body: A US court on Monday reversed the conviction of a man who had been serving a life sentence since 2000 for the murder of his ex-girlfriend. The state attorney of Baltimore City last week asked the court to vacate Adnan Syed's conviction. The prosecution cited discovery of new information and unreliability of incriminating evidence as the reason behind the move.

15.title: 'India won't give any more financial aid to Sri Lanka,' say reports, embassy responds
15.article_body: The Indian embassy in Sri Lanka issued a response after reports said the Indian government will not extend any more financial assistance to Colombo amid an economic crisis. "India has extended unprecedented bilateral assistance amounting close to $4 billion," said the embassy. India is supporting Sri Lanka by promoting long-term investments, scholarships to Lankan students, etc, the embassy added.

16.title: BJP misusing agencies to harass minorities: Ex-Cong MLA Asif Khan
16.article_body: After the arrest of AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan, ex-Delhi Congress MLA Asif Khan alleged the BJP is "misusing" its agencies to "harass" minorities. "I am...against the misuse of agencies, particularly against minorities, by the BJP government," Asif Khan said. Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch on Friday arrested Amanatullah Khan in connection with a corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board.

17.title: Donate money, not flowers and shawls: Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah
17.article_body: Trustee of Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah has appealed to the devotees to donate money instead of flowers and shawls. Many devotees get duped as stale flowers and shawls of substandard quality are sold to them at higher prices, we don't want them to waste their money, trustee Suhail Khandwani said. He added the shrine is undergoing renovation and needs money.

18.title: 2 more arrested for murder of Suresh Raina's uncle & cousin in 2020
18.article_body: Two more people have been arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar for their involvement in the murder of cricketer Suresh Raina's 58-year-old uncle and a cousin during a robbery bid in Punjab's Pathankot in August 2020. Raina's uncle was a contractor by profession. Three accused were arrested a month after the incident took place.

19.title: What an experience: Ananya Panday on Ranbir Kapoor's 'Brahmastra'
19.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to Instagram Stories and reviewed Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "What an experience! Fully in love with this world and everyone in it," she wrote. Ananya added that she's "embarrassingly" late to watch the film and urged her fans to watch it. "Whoever is down to discuss fan theories message me," Ananya further wrote.

20.title: AAP gave liquor contract to its candidate Karanjit: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia
20.article_body: The BJP alleged that the AAP government ignored all the rules and gave the liquor contract to its candidate, Karanjit Singh Lamba. "It has become clear from the sting operation how Arvind Kejriwal makes a recovery. How they earn black money and how people are looted...AAP gave liquor licence to Kejriwal's close aide," said BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

21.title: WB school students protest at railway station over teachers' transfer
21.article_body: Hundreds of students of a school in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas on Tuesday staged a protest on railway tracks over the transfer of their teachers without notice. "We want our message to reach teachers so we are protesting on rail tracks," the students said. Rail traffic at Gourdaha halt railway station in Canning was affected due to the protest.

22.title: 54,810 Russian soldiers killed, 2,216 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
22.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it has killed around 54,810 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 2,216 Russian tanks and over 460 aircraft, including 217 helicopters. The ministry said that 4,724 armoured personnel carriers, 1,323 artillery systems and 318 Multiple Launch Rocket Systems have also been destroyed.

23.title: Only she can explain: Saugata Roy on Bengal CM's remark on PM Modi
23.article_body: Reacting to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's "PM not misusing central agencies" statement, TMC MP Saugata Roy claimed that only Mamata Banerjee can explain the political significance of her statement. "The resolution was passed yesterday in the Assembly in which it is said that the CBI and ED are being misused," Roy said.

24.title: Fintech industry should engage more with govt: FM Sitharaman
24.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the financial technology industry should have more engagements with the government and its agencies across all levels. "The greater the engagement, the greater the trust which gets built up," Sitharaman said. She also added that there are also opportunities for fintech players to play a role in the sustainable financial environment.

25.title: Maha govt ends freeze on MIDC's 181 projects amid Vedanta controversy
25.article_body: The Eknath Shinde government has ended freeze on the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation's (MIDC) allotment of 181 land parcels, an official said. Decisions over remaining 10 are also expected soon. The projects were sanctioned by the previous Uddhav Thackeray government. This development comes at a time when the government is facing criticism for a Vedanta project going to Gujarat.

26.title: Armenia, Azerbaijan leaders meet in NY after deadly border clashes
26.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken hosted foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan, Ararat Mirzoyan and Jeyhun Bayramov, in New York. This was the first direct talks between leaders of the two countries since over 170 soldiers were killed in the recent border clashes. Mirzoyan called for "international mechanisms to prevent further escalations", Armenian Foreign Ministry said in a statement.

27.title: Online gaming platform WinZO sues Google over 'unfair' Play Store policy
27.article_body: WinZO has filed a lawsuit in Delhi HC to stop Google from allowing daily fantasy sports, or real-money games for fantasy sports and rummy, on its Play Store app under a pilot project. WinZO said Google's policy excludes a large sector of real-money games, classified as skill-based games, making it "unfair". "[The move will] distort the market," WinZO added.

28.title: Over 90 airports in India to be carbon-neutral by 2024: Union Minister
28.article_body: Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said over 90 airports in the country will be carbon-neutral by 2024. "In last eight years, number of airports in the country has increased from 74 to 141...this will grow up to 220 in next five years," Scindia added. Currently, the country has 141 airports, of which Kochi and Delhi airports are carbon-neutral, he stated.

29.title: Body of a man found in luggage compartment of Mumbai local train
29.article_body: A body of an unidentified man was found in the luggage compartment of Mumbai's local train at Panvel Railway Station on Tuesday. The deceased is in the age group of 35-40 and his body was spotted by a passenger, police said. The local train where the body was found came from Kurla and was leaving for Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus.

30.title: Moody's withdraws Kalyan Jewellers' rating after fundraise delay
30.article_body: After Kalyan Jewellers India postponed its plans to access the international debt capital markets, rating agency Moody's on Monday withdrew the firm's stable B2 long-term corporate family rating. In April, the company was reportedly planning to raise around $200 million through its subsidiary. Kalyan reported consolidated revenues of ₹10,820 crore and core profit of around ₹850 crore for FY22.

31.title: IAS Shah Faesal withdraws SC plea challenging Article 370 revocation
31.article_body: IAS officer Shah Faesal has withdrawn his petition from the Supreme Court challenging the revocation of Article 370, which granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir, according to a report. This comes months after Faesal was reinstated in the service earlier this year and appointed Deputy Secretary in the Ministry of Culture. He had quit the government service in 2019.

32.title: Bilkis Bano case witness writes to CJI, says convict told him 'I am out now'
32.article_body: A witness in Bilkis Bano case has written to CJI UU Lalit alleging threats from a convict and expressing fear for his life. Imtiaz Ghanchi said convict Radheshyam Shah purportedly told him, "What did you get by calling me an accused, I'm out now" and laughed. Eleven men convicted for gang-rape and murder in the case were freed last month.

33.title: CWG gold was best moment of my life, playing with Sharath was amazing: Sreeja
33.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula said winning the gold medal in mixed doubles with partner  Sharath Kamal at Commonwealth Games 2022 was the "best moment" of her life. "Playing with Sharath was an amazing experience. He guided me really well during the match," she added. "I'm very happy that I did really well in my maiden Games," Sreeja stated.

34.title: Cong appoints Yuri Alemao as legislature party leader in Goa Assembly
34.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday appointed Yuri Alemao as the leader of its legislature party in the Goa Assembly. This comes days after eight Congress MLAs including Digambar Kamat, Michael Lobo, Delilah Lobo, Kedar Naik, Rajesh Faldessai, Sankalp Amonkar, Rodolfo Fernandes and Aleixo Sequeira joined the BJP. Alemao will lead the legislature party that now consists of three MLAs.

35.title: 14 sperm whales die in mass stranding on Australian beach
35.article_body: At least 14 young sperm whales have died in a mass stranding on a beach in Tasmania in Australia. The whale carcasses were discovered on King Island on Monday afternoon, Tasmania's Department of Natural Resources and Environment said. The incident comes two years after more than 380 pilot whales died on Tasmania's west coast in Australia's worst mass stranding.

36.title: CBI files chargesheet against Yes Bank Co-founder in bank fraud case
36.article_body: The CBI reportedly filed a chargesheet against Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and Avantha Group Promoter Gautam Thapar in a ₹466.51-crore bank fraud case. Kapoor was not named in the June 2021 FIR, however, his role surfaced during subsequent probes. CBI alleged that the accused had committed criminal breach of trust and conspiracy to divert public money during 2017-2019 period.

37.title: Don't know of anyone who knows Salman but doesn’t like him: Ali Abbas
37.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said that he misses working with actor Salman Khan. "I don't know of anyone who knows Salman Khan but doesn't like him," he added. Ali has worked with Salman in 'Sultan', 'Tiger Zinda Hai' and 'Bharat'. "If Salman doesn't like you, he will tell you 'today, I don't like you'," Ali further stated.

38.title: Was changing my niece's dirty diaper when I got a call for 'Avatar': Zoe
38.article_body: Actress Zoe Saldana has revealed that she was changing her niece's dirty diaper when she was offered 'Avatar'. "I can't forget getting that phone call from Jim (James Cameron, director) saying, 'I want you to play Neytiri'," Zoe said, adding, "I've never enjoyed a dirty diaper as much as I enjoyed changing that diaper, when I was on...phone with Jim."

39.title: One farmer dying every hour under BJP rule: Congress
39.article_body: The Congress on Tuesday held BJP-led central government's policies responsible for farmers' suicides in the country. "Every day 30 farmers are dying by suicide and every hour more than one farmer is dying," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said while citing NCRB data. This comes after a Pune-based farmer died by suicide over not getting the Minimum Support Price (MSP).

40.title: 50-yr-old labourer killed, wife injured in leopard attack in Gujarat
40.article_body: A 50-year-old labourer from Maharashtra died while his wife was seriously injured after they were attacked by a leopard in Gujarat’s Junagadh on Tuesday, forest officials said. "The man sustained injuries on his neck...and that proved fatal," The Indian Express quoted an official as saying. The incident occurred when the labourer and his wife were asleep in a sanatorium.

41.title: Odisha government increases Dearness Allowance for employees
41.article_body: As a festive gift, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik approved the proposal to increase the Dearness Allowance (DA) by three percent for the state government employees. "Dearness relief for pensioners drawing on a revised rate has also been increased by three percent," the Chief Minister's Office said. The move will benefit nearly four lakh government employees.

42.title: 17 Guj students say teachers call them home for domestic work, run away
42.article_body: Seventeen girl students of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya in Gujarat ran away from school on Sunday after complaining that two teachers were forcing them to come home and do their domestic work. "We have received complaints from class eight students that two teachers are calling them to their homes...even to take care of their children," the school's head teacher said.

43.title: Ukraine using Russian tanks abandoned during counteroffensive: Think tank
43.article_body: Ukraine is deploying left-behind Russian T-72 tanks as it pushes into occupied region of Luhansk, a Washington-based think tank, Institute for the Study of War said. "The initial panic of the counteroffensive led Russian troops to abandon higher-quality equipment in working order," the institute added. Ukraine launched counteroffensive into territory around the second largest city of Kharkiv.

44.title: Will look into it: Aviation Minister on Punjab CM being deplaned for 'being drunk'
44.article_body: Reacting to reports that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was deplaned in Germany's Frankfurt allegedly for being drunk, Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "I will certainly look into it." He said, "The incident took place on international soil. We'll have to make sure that we verify the facts." It was up to Lufthansa airline to provide the data, Scindia added.

45.title: Let's not talk about this: Mani Ratnam on question about Vairamuthu
45.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam, during an event, refused to answer a question regarding lyricist Vairamuthu. When asked how he felt about Vairamuthu not being a part of 'Ponniyin Selvan', Ratnam replied, "Let's not talk about this now." Vairamuthu, who was initially a part of the film, was dropped after he was called out in the MeToo movement by singer Chinmayi Sripaada.

46.title: Gauri Khan only turns up when she is not invited: Bhavana Pandey
46.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey has stated that Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan only turns up to events if she is not invited. "If you invite her she's like, 'Oh God, it's too boring, I don't want to come'," Bhavana added. She further said her daughter actress Ananya Panday is "extremely sensitive and very empathic".

47.title: Tries to make everything controversial: BJP on Mufti's 'Hindutva agenda' remark
47.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP leader Kavinder Gupta criticised PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti over her 'Hindutva agenda' comment, saying she tries to make everything controversial. "May the PDP leader be blessed with good thoughts," Gupta said. This comes after Mufti shared a video of Kashmiri students singing 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' hymn and accused the BJP of propagating its Hindutva agenda.

48.title: We were stopped by govt from protesting outside UP Assembly: Akhilesh
48.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said his party was stopped by the government from holding a protest outside the UP Assembly on Monday. Yadav and other party leaders took out a march against the UP government yesterday. "When the government didn’t allow us to protest in the Assembly, then the SP decided the path of streets," Yadav added.

49.title: Tonga volcano erupts 8 times in 2 days; releases molten lava
49.article_body: A volcano north of Tonga's main island has erupted eight times in the last two days, the country's geological service said, warning mariners to keep their distance from the area on Tuesday. The Home Reef volcano, which began erupting on September 10, has been oozing molten lava and shooting steam and ash at least three kilometres into the air.

50.title: Boycott B'wood is necessary, 90% of industry is corrupt: Faissal Khan
50.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan said that Boycott Bollywood is a necessary movement, adding that "all the evils of Bollywood" came to light after Sushant Singh Rajput's death. "The world got to know the dirty side of Bollywood. And how much arrogance is there in the industry," he added. Faissal further said that 90% of the industry is corrupt.

51.title: Definition of dignity has changed with time: SC in Karnataka hijab matter
51.article_body: Senior advocate Dushyant Dave, representing petitioners challenging Karnataka High Court's judgement on hijab, told Supreme Court that hijab adds to dignity and makes a woman very dignified when she wears it, like a Hindu woman who covers her head, it's dignified. A bench comprising Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia told Dave that definition of dignity has changed with time.

52.title: All lions at Hyd zoo are healthy: Officials as visitor raises concern
52.article_body: After a Twitter user pointed out the "poor health" of lions at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad, officials said all the 20 lions are healthy except two which are under treatment. "The misleading statement is strongly condemned," an official statement said. The Twitter user had said that he found the lions at Nehru Park to be extremely sick.

53.title: Follow 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Prayas': PM to BJP Mayors
53.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday directed BJP Mayors to follow the motto of "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas and Sabka Prayas". "It's the responsibility of...Mayors to work from the grassroots level," he added. He called for decentralisation of urban planning. The PM also urged the Mayors to follow the path of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, who was also a Mayor.

54.title: US woman who faked her kidnapping sentenced to 18 months in jail
54.article_body: The 39-year-old California woman who faked her own kidnapping in 2016 has been sentenced to 18 months in prison. Sherri Papini had claimed she was abducted by two Hispanic women, while authorities later found that she had been living with her ex-boyfriend. Papini will have to pay $309,902 in restitution for losses incurred by several agencies, including the FBI.

55.title: Portugal-bound Ryanair flight unexpectedly lands 400 km away in Spain
55.article_body: A passenger took to Twitter after a Ryanair flight from Dublin-Portugal unexpectedly landed 400 km away in Malaga, Spain. Passengers reportedly didn't realise they were in the wrong country until after they landed. While the airline sent one bus to transport the passengers, it said that the re-route took place due to a strike by French Air Traffic Control.

56.title: TV actor Shalin Bhanot to be part of 'Bigg Boss 16': Report
56.article_body: Television actor Shalin Bhanot has reportedly agreed to participate in 'Bigg Boss 16', which will premiere on October 1. As per the report, Bhanot is "excited" to be part of the new season of the reality show. Apart from Bhanot, celebrities such as Kanika Mann, Arjun Bijlani, Munawar Faruqui and others have also been reportedly approached for the show.

57.title: Arvind Kejriwal greeted with chants of 'Modi-Modi' in Gujarat
57.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi' after he arrived at the Vadodara airport in Gujarat. In a video that surfaced online, Kejriwal could be seen smiling while moving towards the media persons after hearing the chants of PM Narendra Modi's name. Notably, Kejriwal is on a day-long visit to poll-bound Gujarat.

58.title: Over 30,000 illegal foreigners deported till August 31: Assam minister
58.article_body: Over 30,000 illegal foreigners have so far been deported from the state based on the Assam Accord. Atul Bora, the Assam Accord Implementation Minister, informed the state Assembly on Monday that 1,48,022 illegal foreigners have been detected in the state till August 31. As many as 31,953 infiltrators had entered India before March 25, 1971, and 1,16,069 had come after.

59.title: Pulse polio booths at Delhi Metro stations to be operational till Sept 23
59.article_body: The Pulse polio booths which have been set up at selected metro stations in Delhi will be operational till September 23. The booths remain open from 8 am to 2 pm and 2 pm to 8 pm. The booths are set up at metro stations like Tis Hazari, Kashmere Gate, Seelampur, Shastri Park, Pul Bangash, Pratap Nagar, etc.

60.title: 21-yr-old delivery agent beaten with belt over parking dispute in Guj
60.article_body: A security guard of a residential society allegedly thrashed a 21-year-old pizza delivery boy in Gujarat's Ahmedabad with a belt over a parking dispute. The victim asked the guards to help him remove a scooter that was parked in front of his vehicle, following which one of the guards took his belt out and beat him.

61.title: Denied cigarette, tourist fires shots inside Shimla restaurant; arrested
61.article_body: A tourist was arrested for allegedly firing gunshots inside a restaurant in Shimla on Tuesday morning. The man, identified as Vishwanath, allegedly threatened to kill a waiter and fired rounds in air after the latter refused to bring him food and cigarette citing closing of business hours. Vishwanath was booked under Sections 336 and 506 of IPC and Arms Act.

62.title: Husband, 3 others arrested for woman's murder outside Panvel railway station
62.article_body: Husband of the 29-year-old woman whose throat was slit outside Panvel railway station last week has been arrested with his girlfriend, her employer and a contract killer. The man reportedly had an extramarital affair and married his girlfriend in August. When his wife learnt about this, he and the other two accused allegedly hired people to kill her.

63.title: Palestinian security forces and gunmen clash in West Bank; 1 dead
63.article_body: A 53-year-old man on Tuesday was killed in clashes between Palestinian gunmen and Palestinian Authority's security forces in the West Bank, as per medics. The violence reportedly erupted after the arrest of two militants, one of whom Hamas claims is its senior member wanted by Israel. Militant organisation Hamas is the rival of Fatah that controls the Palestinian Authority.

64.title: India great emerging market, best bet in global economy: Ashok Hinduja
64.article_body: Hinduja Group Chairman Ashok Hinduja called India "the very great emerging, fast-moving market" and said it is the "best bet" in the global economy. "We see a recession coming in the US...UK, Europe, problems in China...we focus now (on) India," he said. He further said India is politically well settled as PM Narendra Modi has handled international relations well.

65.title: Was told I'll never be an actress if I only do item songs: Gauahar Khan
65.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan stated in an interview that she was told when she started out that she will never be an actress if she doesn't star opposite a big actor or only does item songs. "I just hope I can keep defying every kind of stereotype...I've been fighting these things throughout my career," the actress added.

66.title: Several areas of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday: Authorities
66.article_body: The water supply in several parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and other civil works in the municipal water centres, the authorities informed. The areas which will be affected include Peth areas, Deccan, Shivajinagar, Sahakar Nagar, parts of Kondhwa, Kalas and Tingre Nagar. The supply will be restored in the affected areas on Friday.

67.title: Mumbai Airport witnesses passenger movement of 1,30,374 in 1 day
67.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport witnessed a record passenger movement of 1,30,374 on September 17, reports said. Nearly 95,080 passengers travelled through Terminal 2 (T2) and 35,294 via Terminal 1 (T1) of the airport on September 17. A total of 839 flight movements were recorded on this day, according to reports.

68.title: Satellite pics show massive crowds at Queen Elizabeth's funeral in London
68.article_body: Satellite images over London on Monday showed massive crowds that lined streets to see Queen Elizabeth II's funeral procession. Thousands of people were seen lining the streets and the areas along the procession route shortly after the Queen's coffin left Westminster Hall for Windsor Castle, where she was laid to rest. The Queen was laid to rest alongside her family.

69.title: Shefali Shah honoured with Italy's Alberto Sordi Family Awards
69.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has been honoured with the Alberto Sordi Family Award which honours Italian and international figures close to the thought of actor-director Alberto Sordi. Shefali shared pictures from the event on social media, writing, "This year among the recipients is me. What can I say except that I am shocked, extremely humbled and thankful...truly unbelievable."

70.title: People sell daughters to free those caught selling hooch: BJP MP
70.article_body: Bhopal BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur has alleged that people in three of the villages she has adopted are forced to sell their daughters to free those caught selling illicit liquor for a living. Her statement invited sharp criticism from Congress, which said it reflected the ground reality under the BJP's 'Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao' campaign.

71.title: Exposing Hindutva agenda in J&K: Mufti on students singing Ram Dhun
71.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti shared a video of Kashmiri students singing 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' and accused the BJP-led Central government of propagating its Hindutva agenda in J&K. BJP leader Kavinder Gupta said that Mufti has been trying to mislead the public regarding the bhajan 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' being sung in a school in Kashmir.

72.title: Tier 2 and tier 3 cities can also be centres of economic activity: PM Modi
72.article_body: PM Narendra Modi called for creating economic opportunities in tier two and tier three cities to make them centres of economic activity to ease the pressure on bigger cities. "Most of the startups now are being set up in tier two and tier three cities...We should also increase industrial clusters in such places," said PM Modi.

73.title: Uganda declares Ebola outbreak after rare Sudan strain found
73.article_body: Uganda has declared Ebola outbreak after authorities confirmed a case of rare Sudan strain, health ministry and the World Health Organization said. A 24-year-old man developed high fever, diarrhoea, abdominal pain and was vomiting blood before he died, a health official said. There are currently eight suspected cases of Ebola receiving care in a health facility, WHO's Africa office said.

74.title: Hero Group, KKR to invest $450 million in Hero Future Energies
74.article_body: American private equity firm KKR and Hero Group have agreed to invest $450 million in Hero Future Energies (HFE). HFE plans to expand the renewable energy capacity, reduce carbon emissions by 1 billion tonnes by 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions by 2070. Founded in 2012, HFE has a diversified portfolio of 1.6 GW of operating solar and wind projects.

75.title: It's an interesting character, I learnt beatboxing: Tamannaah on 'Babli...'
75.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has said she learnt how to ride a bullet for her upcoming movie 'Babli Bouncer'. She added she also learnt beatboxing. "Babli is an interesting character," said Tamannaah. The film, directed by Madhur Bhandarkar, will feature Tamannaah as a female bouncer. 'Babli Bouncer' is all set to release on September 23 on an OTT platform.

76.title: Supreme Court upholds validity of Haryana Sikh Gurudwara Act
76.article_body: The Supreme Court has upheld the constitutional validity of the Haryana Sikh Gurdwara (Management) Act, 2014, under which a separate committee was formed to manage the affairs of gurdwaras in the state. The bench dismissed the plea filed by a member of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee seeking quashing of the Haryana Sikh Gurdwara Act.

77.title: Leaders must tackle conflicts, climate crisis, poverty, inequality: UN chief
77.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned that the world is in "great peril" and urged leaders to tackle conflicts, climate catastrophes, increasing poverty and inequality. He said leaders should address divisions among major powers that have become worse since Russia invaded Ukraine. Guterres will deliver "state of the world" speech at the 77th United Nations General Assembly in New York.

78.title: Manjrekar opts out of film on Savarkar, Randeep Hooda to direct: Reports
78.article_body: Director Mahesh Manjrekar has reportedly opted out of the film based on the life of Veer Savarkar. According to reports, actor Randeep Hooda will now direct the upcoming biopic in addition to playing the lead role in it. The film, titled 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', will reportedly go on the floors next week in Maharashtra.

79.title: When you dance with SRK, you feel like film's heroine: Vrushali Chavan
79.article_body: Choreographer-actress Vrushali Chavan said she fell in love with actor Shah Rukh Khan after working with him. "When you rehearse with him, you feel like you are the heroine of the film. And he will give you the sweetest kiss on your forehead," she added. Vrushali said that Shah Rukh never takes advantage of his position and follows orders.

80.title: Priyanka Gandhi to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala: Jairam Ramesh
80.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said that the party's General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will join the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala. "We have completed 275 km of Bharat Jodo Yatra," added Ramesh in Alappuzha. The foot march, which aims to cover 3,570 km from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir in 150 days, was launched on September 7.

81.title: World Bank approves loan worth $150 million for Punjab
81.article_body: The World Bank's Board of Executive Directors on Monday approved a loan worth $150 million (over ₹1,195 crore) for Punjab to help the state better manage its financial resources and improve access to public services. The agency's Country Director in India, Auguste Tano Kouame, said that the World Bank is "pleased to be a partner of the state of Punjab".

82.title: Can Fin Homes shares fall 6% a day after MD & CEO Kousgi resigns
82.article_body: The shares of mortgage lender Can Fin Homes declined up to 6% in early trade on Tuesday, a day after its Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Girish Kousgi resigned citing personal reasons. At 11 am, its stock was trading at ₹575.9 apiece on the BSE. Its stock had hit a two-month low of ₹571.2 on August 22.

83.title: Tamil Nadu woman refuses to rent out flat to Scheduled Caste man, booked
83.article_body: A woman was booked for allegedly refusing to rent out a flat to a man belonging to Scheduled Caste. The woman reportedly said that she would not rent the flat to any Muslim, Christian or Scheduled Caste/ Scheduled Tribe person as it would offend her family deity. Members of a Dalit political party said that she would be punished.

84.title: Bengaluru doctor posts fiancee's nude pics on social media, killed; 3 arrested
84.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 27-year-old architect, Prathibha, and her two male friends on charges of murdering her live-in partner and fiance, Dr N Vikas, for allegedly uploading her nude photos on social media. Police said Prathibha found that Vikas uploaded photos of her and her mother using a fake ID. Police said Dr Vikas worked at a private hospital.

85.title: BJP, PM don't need validation from Mamata: Amit Malviya
85.article_body: Reacting to Mamata Banerjee's statement that she does not believe that PM Narendra Modi is misusing central agencies, BJP IT Cell head Amit Malviya said that no one in BJP, and most certainly the PM, needs any validation from her. "Her entire govt, top ministers...immediate family is under the radar of central agencies, because the courts ordered investigation," he added.

86.title: 38-yr-old Mumbai man held for stealing 27 bicycles worth ₹2.6 lakh
86.article_body:
A 38-year-old resident of Dharavi, Raes Tavar Khan, has been arrested for allegedly stealing 27 bicycles worth ₹2.6 lakh from Mumbai's Bandra, Khar, Shivaji Park and Lamington Road areas.
"We intercepted Khan as we found his movements to be suspicious," police said. "We suspect...some of the stolen bicycles belong to...Dabbawalas, who are an integral part of the city," police added.

87.title: PepsiCo ends Pepsi, 7UP and Mountain Dew production in Russia
87.article_body: PepsiCo has stopped producing Pepsi, 7UP and Mountain Dew in Russia nearly six months after it said it would suspend sales and production over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "All concentrates have subsequently been exhausted in Russia and production has ended," a PepsiCo spokesperson said. The spokesperson added that this was "in line with the announcement we made in March".

88.title: Matrimonial ad asks software engineers to 'not call'; social media users react
88.article_body: After a matrimonial ad asked software engineers to "not call", a Twitter user wrote, "Can Mechanical engineers call." Sharing the undated newspaper ad, the founder of Helios Capital, Samir Arora wrote, "Future of IT does not look so sound." "Don't worry...Engineers don't rely on some newspaper ad. They find everything on their own," another user wrote.

89.title: Ranbir & I are not 'two bodies one soul' kind of people: Alia Bhatt
89.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she and her husband Ranbir Kapoor are strong individuals. "We both respect our individual personalities and professional commitments together. We're not do jism ek jaan (two bodies one soul) kind of people," she added. Alia stated they have a "beautiful" relationship as companions and have a better working relationship as they're passionate about films.

90.title: Assam passes Bill with penal provisions for pvt educational institutions
90.article_body: Assam Legislative Assembly on Monday passed the Assam Non-Government Educational Institutions (Regulation of Fees) (Amendment) Bill, 2022. The Bill includes penal measures against private institutions that do not comply with the provisions of the Fee Regulation Act. The non-government educational institutions have been asked to file applications before the Fee Regulatory Committee by October 31.

91.title: Man flashes his private part at minor girl in Navi Mumbai; booked
91.article_body: Police have booked an unidentified person for allegedly flashing his private part at a girl while asking for an address in Navi Mumbai's Vashi. According to police, the accused man had also offered her to sit on his motorbike to help him in locating the address, which the girl refused. "We...are checking the CCTV footage...to trace the accused," police said.

92.title: Don’t fall prey to fake website selling plots near Noida airport: YEIDA
92.article_body: A fake website called yamunaawasiyabhukhand.in is allegedly offering residential plots near the Noida airport site, Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) CEO Arunvir Singh has warned in a notice. The website is misusing YEIDA's main project details and its master plan. It reportedly pretends to provide inexpensive apartments close to the airport to deceive unwary investors.

93.title: Environmentalist dies by suicide over corruption in PDS in K'taka
93.article_body: A 68-year-old environmentalist allegedly died by suicide over corruption in Public Distribution System (PDS) in Karnataka's Davanagere district on Tuesday. Veerachari had earlier claimed that food items in PDS shops were not being distributed to marginalised sections of society and pledged to end his life if justice wasn't delivered. Following the incident, local residents staged a protest.

94.title: Israel appoints ambassador to Turkey for first time since 2018
94.article_body: Israel on Monday announced the appointment of Irit Lillian as its new ambassador to Turkey. Lillian is the first person to hold the post since 2018. Turkey withdrew its ambassador from Israel and ordered Israel's ambassador to leave the country in 2018 over the killing of dozens of Palestinians by Israeli forces during border protests along the Gaza border.

95.title: Sub-contractor detained after boundary wall collapse in Noida kills 4
95.article_body: Hours after a portion of a Noida housing society's boundary wall collapsed on Tuesday, police have detained the sub-contractor who supplied labourers for repairing a drain there. Eight people were injured in the incident that took place at Jal Vayu Vihar in Noida Sector 21. All 12 labourers were buried under the rubble.

96.title: He needs to improve: Indian men's wrestling coach on Ravi's World C'ships loss
96.article_body: Indian men's wrestling coach Sujeet Maan said that Ravi Dahiya needs to improve after the Olympic silver medallist's loss to Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev in the 57-kg category pre-quarterfinal at the recently concluded World Wrestling Championships. "He (Ravi) knows he has to improve and there is certainly no one more disappointed with his performance than he himself is," he added.

97.title: CPI MP writes to President, says 'Kerala Governor's actions unconstitutional'
97.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu accusing the Kerala Governor of having an open collision with the state government and called his actions anti-constitutional. "The Governor has stated that he was not inclined to give assent to the bills passed by the Assembly...He is sworn to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution," said Viswam.

98.title: T'gana man stabbed with injection after offering lift to stranger; dies later
98.article_body: A 46-year-old man in Telangana's Khammam died on Monday after an unidentified man allegedly stabbed him with an injection after seeking a lift on the deceased's two-wheeler. The suspect escaped from the scene after administering the injection, police said. The deceased sought help from people nearby, complaining of giddiness. He soon fainted and was taken to a hospital.

99.title: Over 40 lakes disappeared in Bengaluru since 1963: Karnataka minister
99.article_body: During a debate about floods in Karnataka, state Revenue Minister R Ashoka told the Karnataka Assembly that over 40 lakes have disappeared in Bengaluru since 1963. Buildings and layouts have been built on levelled lakes in areas like Rajajinagar and Dollars Colony, he added. He alleged that most of the encroachments on lakes happened during the tenure of Congress government.

100.title: Building collapses, fire incidents are major concern in cities: PM
100.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the collapse of old buildings and incidents of buildings catching fire in cities are a major concern. "This can be avoided if rules are followed," he added while addressing BJP mayors' conference. His remarks come on a day when a building wall in a Noida residential complex came down, killing four workers.

101.title: 4 nations including Poland turn away Russian tourists over Ukraine war
101.article_body: Poland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania have begun turning away Russian tourists, saying they should not enter while their country is at war with Ukraine. Finland has reduced consular appointments for Russian travellers seeking visas. The ban excludes Russian dissidents seeking refuge. The European Union has banned all flights from Russia, keeping only rail and road transport links operational.

102.title: IIT Bombay girl student filmed inside hostel bathroom by canteen worker
102.article_body: A canteen worker at IIT Bombay was arrested for recording a video of a girl student while she was in the hostel bathroom, students of the institute have alleged. The student noticed the accused's phone looming outside the bathroom window, filming her, and alerted the hostel council and authorities. The worker had allegedly climbed pipes to peep inside the bathroom.

103.title: Stopped from making reels, UP woman tries to strangle her brothers
103.article_body: Police have registered a case against a young woman after she attempted to strangulate her two younger brothers when they stopped her from making video reels in UP's Farrukhabad, according to a report. She even allegedly assaulted women police constables and tore their uniform. Her brother reportedly said she had an addiction of making reels and uploading them on Instagram.

104.title: Bridge left twisted, cracked after strong earthquake in Taiwan; video surfaces
104.article_body: A strong 6.8 magnitude earthquake that hit southeastern Taiwan on Sunday left the Gaoliao Bridge twisted and cracked. Since Saturday evening, dozens of earthquakes have hit the island's southeastern coast. The earthquakes also toppled a three-story building and knocked a part of a passenger train off its tracks.

105.title: Jet Airways warns job applicants of fake interviews, issues statement
105.article_body: Ahead of its relaunch, Jet Airways issued a statement in reference to its job applications. The airline said that some people impersonating Jet Airways employees are demanding money in exchange for interviews or jobs at the airline. "Jet Airways does not solicit any payment for any recruitment," it added. It further asked applicants to check the source of job postings.

106.title: 31 students fall sick after eating dinner at Telangana school
106.article_body: As many as 31 students fell sick after eating dinner at a minority residential school in Telangana's Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district on Monday. They were rushed to a hospital, where their condition was said to be stable. Some students complained that they were getting low-quality food for the past three days and that they even found insects in the food.

107.title: Cash crunch due to wrong vastu, will shut Hyd Bus Bhavan south gate: TSRTC
107.article_body: Authorities of Telangana State Road Transport Corporation said the corporation faced financial loss possibly due to wrong vastu alignment. Accordingly, they're planning to shut the south entry gate of Hyderabad's Bus Bhavan and open an east-facing gate that they believe "aligns well with vastu shastra and will bring better luck". The east symbolises life and brings light, an official said.

108.title: Rana Daggubati snatches fan's phone over selfie at Tirupati temple
108.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati recently visited the Tirupati temple along with his wife Miheeka Bajaj and his father D Suresh Babu. A video going viral on social media shows a fan trying to pose with Rana for a selfie when Rana snatches his phone. The actor can then be seen returning the fan's phone and saying, "No selfies in a temple."

109.title: 2 tribal women tonsured after panchayat finds them guilty of abetting suicide
109.article_body: A panchayat in Telangana's Nalgonda allegedly forcefully tonsured two tribal women after charging them with abetting the suicide of a 16-year-old of the same community. The two women were tied to a tree, reportedly abused and beaten up by villagers on Saturday, police officials said. The panchayat allegedly issued a diktat that police shouldn't be informed about the incident.

110.title: PFI leader arrested over RSS worker's murder in Kerala
110.article_body: A PFI leader, Aboobaker Siddik, has been arrested for killing an RSS worker in Kerala’s Palakkad district. He was apprehended on Monday for allegedly conspiring and hiding the culprits involved in the murder. "He is the 23rd accused in the Srinivasan murder case who has been arrested...He was taken into custody from his house," said the investigating officer.

111.title: 2 killed, 3 injured after lightning strikes shop in Chhattisgarh
111.article_body: Two men died and three other people were injured after lightning struck them in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Monday evening. According to a police official, the deceased, identified as Nandlal Paikra and Sanjay Yadav, had taken shelter at a shop below a tree after it started raining. Suddenly lightning struck there, killing Paikra and Yadav on the spot, he added.

112.title: Ex-Meta executives' startup TrueFoundry raises $2.3 mn in seed round
112.article_body: US-based machine learning startup TrueFoundry has secured $2.3 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India and Surge. AngelList Talent Co-founder Naval Ravikant and Eniac Ventures participated in the round. TrueFoundry was co-founded by ex-Meta executives Nikunj Bajaj, Abhishek Choudhary and angel investor Anuraag Gutgutia. Angel investors include Deutsche India CEO, Dilip Khandelwal.

113.title: Auto driver, 4 others arrested for robbing 2 men at knifepoint in Mumbai
113.article_body: The Kurar Police arrested an auto driver and four others for allegedly robbing two men at knifepoint in Malad East, Mumbai. The accused were identified as Akash Shinde, Ganesh Anil Raje, Mahesh Kamble, Sunny Ghode and Ram Raje. The victims, Deenbandhu Das and Kallan Dulai, were waiting to hire an auto outside a restaurant when the incident happened, police said.

114.title: Have directed strict action: Thakur on players being served food kept in toilet
114.article_body: Reacting to the video of food kept in a toilet being served to kabaddi players in UP's Saharanpur, Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said that he has directed strict action against the accused contractor and officers. "I have also directed that the contractor be blacklisted for the future," he added. The district sports officer was suspended after the incident.

115.title: UK-US trade deal could be years away: British PM Liz Truss
115.article_body: The UK may not strike a free trade deal with the US for years, British PM Liz Truss said ahead of her first bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden in New York. Truss said she was more focused on obtaining accession to the Trans-Pacific trade partnership and striking trade deals with India and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).

116.title: Maroon 5's Adam Levine accused of cheating on wife, Instagram model shares alleged DMs
116.article_body: 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine has been accused of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo by an Instagram influencer. Sumner Stroh released a TikTok video alleging she and Levine were having an affair. She shared screenshots of DMs allegedly from Levine, where they appeared to flirt, and a text from him asking if he could name his child after her.

117.title: Delhi HC proceeds ex-parte against Vivek Agnihotri in 2018 contempt case
117.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday proceeded ex-parte against filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, scientist Anand Ranganathan, and magazine and news portal Swarajya in connection with a 2018 contempt case. This comes after the three failed to appear or send their representatives to court. The case was filed over their criticism of Justice S Muralidhar for granting bail to Urban Naxal Gautam Navlakha.

118.title: Two drunk Army men create ruckus at Bengaluru airport, arrested
118.article_body: Two Army men were arrested for allegedly assaulting on-duty security personnel at Bengaluru airport in an inebriated condition, reports said. The accused were trying to drive in a lane designated for VIPs and CISF personnel when they were stopped, reports added. They were attending a party near Bengaluru and went to the airport to sober up, reports further said.

119.title: Tiger Global-backed Zopper raises $75 mn in Series C funding round
119.article_body: Insurtech startup Zopper on Tuesday said it has raised $75 million in a Series C funding round led by Creaegis, which also saw participation from ICICI Venture and Bessemer Venture Partners, and existing investor Blume Ventures. Co-founded by Surjendu Kuila and Mayank Gupta in 2011, the company said that Tiger Global will continue to extend its support for future growth.

120.title: Alia Bhatt receives Smita Patil Memorial Award for Best Actor
120.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has been felicitated with Priyadarshni Academy's Smita Patil Memorial Award for Best Actor. She was felicitated virtually by Union Ministers on Monday for her "outstanding and critically acclaimed performances in Hindi films". "India has the most incredible legacy of the arts and I'm eternally grateful that our work is a part of it," the actress said.

121.title: Very excited: Anees Bazmee on his action-comedy after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
121.article_body: Director Anees Bazmee on Tuesday announced that he will be helming a "larger-than-life" action-comedy, which he promises to be a film that "the Indian audiences have never seen before". "After the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', I want to give our audiences an even bigger dose of entertainment," he said, adding that he's "very excited" about the upcoming project.

122.title: Water supply to be affected in parts of Thane on Wednesday
122.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) announced that a 12-hour water cut will be enforced in some parts of Thane on Wednesday (September 21). The water supply will be cut from 9 am to 9 pm to carry out maintenance work at Pise filtration plant. The strainer at the plant is clogged with silt and garbage after being flooded, TMC said.

123.title: Who are the most expensive buys of the first-ever SA20 auction?
123.article_body: Batter Tristan Stubbs is the most expensive buy of the first-ever SA20 auction, being bought by Sunrisers Eastern Cape for Rand 9.2 million. Batter Rilee Rossouw, bought by Pretoria Capitals for Rand 6.9 million, is the second-most expensive buy. He is followed by Marco Jansen (Sunrisers Eastern Cape, Rand 6.1 million) and Wayne Parnell (Pretoria Capitals, Rand 5.6 million)

124.title: Never date 2 boys at same time: Gauri on her dating advice to Suhana
124.article_body: Talking about the dating advice she would give her daughter Suhana Khan, Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan said, "Never date two boys at the same time." Gauri made this remark during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Discussing the film title she would use to describe her love story with SRK, Gauri stated, "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge".

125.title: BYJU'S financial results 2nd blockbuster release of 2022 after Brahmāstra: Co-founder
125.article_body: BYJU'S Co-founder Divya Gokulnath claimed the edtech startup's financial results are "second blockbuster release" of 2022, after Brahmāstra. BYJU'S, which reported its results after 18-month delay, said losses for FY21 stood at ₹4,500 crore. Accusing media of "sensationalism", Gokulnath said, "It's easy [to] forget...we're 18 months post FY21, and...BYJU'S has grown over 4 times in this span."

126.title: Porn videos of young girls being sold on Twitter for ₹20: DCW chief Swati Maliwal
126.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's Chairperson Swati Maliwal has claimed that porn videos of young girls are being sold on Twitter for ₹20-30. She tweeted, "Twitter has become a medium for selling pornographic videos of children. Videos of rape of young girls are flooded on Twitter." She said she has summoned Twitter India policy head and Delhi Police over the issue.

127.title: Officer suspended after Kabaddi players served food kept in toilet
127.article_body: A district sports officer in UP's Saharanpur, Animesh Saxena, has been suspended after reports of food kept in a toilet being served to Kabaddi players surfaced. The players had claimed that they were given half-cooked rice for lunch and when they complained, the cook placed rice in the toilet. A probe was ordered into the incident by the state government.

128.title: Deepika Padukone should play Amrita in Brahmāstra 2: Alia Bhatt
128.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she sees Deepika Padukone as the character Amrita in 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev'. "She is gorgeous and stunning. She has that amazing stature," Alia added. Actor Ranbir Kapoor stated that Dev and Amrita are the most interesting characters in the trilogy, adding that it will be exciting for any actor to play the characters.

129.title: Huge BJP protest in Jaipur after over 50,000 cows died due to lumpy skin disease in Raj
129.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party on Tuesday staged a protest in Jaipur in connection with lumpy skin disease that has killed over 50,000 cattle in Rajasthan. Reports said the protestors clashed with police and broke barricades. They also raised slogans. Meanwhile, a BJP legislator, on Monday, brought a cow outside state Assembly to draw government attention towards the disease.

130.title: Prime suspect in TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh’s murder arrested by CBI
130.article_body: The CBI has arrested Sona Sheikh, who is one of the key suspects in TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh’s murder. He was arrested from Suri town in Birbhum and has been sent to CBI custody for four days. Earlier in March, a mob allegedly comprised of Bhadu’s associates had set 10 houses on fire, killing eight, including women and children.

131.title: Leaving out Pant in T20 WC 2022 will be the best thing: Wasim Jaffer
131.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said leaving out Rishabh Pant in the T20 World Cup 2022 will be the "best thing". Jaffer added that Pant's best role in the lineup would be that of an opener which he doesn't consider as a viable option. Jaffer stated that India should leave out Pant and pick Dinesh Karthik and Axar Patel instead.

132.title: Indonesia passes data privacy law that punishes leaks with 6-year jail term
132.article_body: Indonesian Parliament has passed a data protection bill that includes corporate fines and up to six years of imprisonment for those found mishandling data. The bill has been passed after data leaks and alleged breaches like a contact-tracing COVID-19 application that revealed President Joko Widodo's vaccine records. The fine includes 2% of a corporation's annual revenue and confiscation of assets.

133.title: DMK Deputy General Secretary Subbulakshmi Jagadeesan quits politics
133.article_body: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) Deputy General Secretary Subbulakshmi Jagadeesan on Tuesday announced her resignation from the party and also from politics. "I submitted my resignation to party president MK Stalin on August 29. I am quitting the DMK and also from active politics," she said. Jagadeesan was Union Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment from 2004 to 2009.

134.title: Tunisia's anti-terrorism police detain former PM Laarayedh: Lawyers
134.article_body: Tunisia's anti-terrorism police have detained former Prime Minister and Opposition party Ennahda's senior official Ali Laarayedh for one day, lawyers said. According to lawyers, Laarayedh was detained after an investigation into suspicions of sending terrorists to Syria. Ennahda has denied accusations of terrorism, calling it a political attack on Tunisian President Kais Saied's foe.

135.title: Don't touch foreigners: Chinese official advice to avoid monkeypox
135.article_body: A top Chinese health official has warned citizens against touching foreigners and recent returnees from abroad after mainland China confirmed its first case of monkeypox. "It is necessary and very important to strengthen the surveillance and prevention of monkeypox epidemic at the social level," Wu Zunyou, chief epidemiologist at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, said.

136.title: 3 police constables suspended in Pune history-sheeter attack case
136.article_body: The Pune police on Monday suspended three police constables for dereliction of duty in the case of history-sheeter Tushar Hambir's attack at Sassoon General Hospital earlier this month. The three constables were allegedly deployed for the security detail but were not present when the attack took place. The constables were suspended following a preliminary investigation into the same.

137.title: Korean actor Tae-oh enlists in military, to complete service in 2024
137.article_body: Korean actor Kang Tae-oh enlisted in the military on September 20. On Monday, the actor took to Instagram to thank his fans for their love and support. He said he will return after completing his military service, which is expected to end in 2024. Reportedly, Tae-ho will reprise his role of Lee Jun-ho in the sequel of 'Extraordinary Attorney Woo'.

138.title: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey to be questioned in Twitter-Musk lawsuit today
138.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey will be questioned under oath today in Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk, court filings showed. Dorsey will be questioned by attorneys from both sides via Zoom. He had been subpoenaed last month by Musk seeking documents and communications about Twitter's use of mDAU, a measure of active users on its platform.

139.title: Will restore old pension scheme if elected to power in Gujarat: Rahul Gandhi
139.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday assured that if Congress is elected to power in Gujarat, then it will restore the old pension scheme, like in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh. "By abolishing the old pension...BJP has made the elderly dependent from self-reliant," he tweeted. Earlier, thousands of retired government employees in Gujarat held protests demanding re-introduction of the old scheme.

140.title: B'luru doctor murdered for uploading nudes of live-in partner on social media
140.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a 27-year-old architect and two of her friends on charges of murdering her live-in partner for allegedly uploading her private photos on social media. Both Vikas and Prathibha were in a relationship and lived together. Prathibha recently discovered that Vikas uploaded her and her mother's photographs on social media using a fake ID, police said.

141.title: I was broke for most of my dating life, a girl gave me ₹5,000 monthly: Vijay
141.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma has revealed that most of his dating life happened when he was "broke", adding that it is "very tragic". The actor further said that paying bills on dates would become awkward and there were girls who were violently against him paying. "This girl...used to give me ₹5,000 or something like that monthly," the actor added.

142.title: Metro network in India now reached 775 km from less than 250 km in 2014: PM
142.article_body: Till 2014, metro network in the country was less than 250 kilometres long but today it is more than 775 kilometres, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. PM Modi was addressing the Council of Mayors and Deputy Mayors of BJP in Gandhinagar, Gujarat via video conferencing. Furthermore, he said, "Tier-2 and tier-3 cities are now becoming centre of economic activities."

143.title: 35-yr-old driver found dead in Gurugram, neighbour booked for murder
143.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who worked as a driver at a private company, was found dead in bushes in a parking lot in Gurugram's Sector 33, police said. The man's neighbour was booked for the murder after his family alleged that he was killed over personal enmity. "Our neighbour [suspected] that his wife eloped with my son," the victim's father said.

144.title: 2 killed as powerful earthquake hits Mexico for 3rd time on same date
144.article_body: A magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck western Mexico on Monday, as the country was marking the anniversaries of two major quakes that had struck Mexico on the same date in 1985 and 2017. At least two people have been killed so far. One person was crushed by the facade of a department store while another was found dead at a mall.

145.title: Told Ayan 'One can play drinking game': Alia on 'Shiva' dialogue in Brahmastra
145.article_body: Discussing her constant repetition of the dialogue 'Shiva' in 'Brahmastra', actress Alia Bhatt said, "I told [director] Ayan Mukerji [that] people can...play a drinking game based on the number of times I've said Shiva." Talking about the same subject, Ranbir Kapoor said, "Ayan was...particular that when someone's in love, they've to enjoy saying the name of the person they love."

146.title: 'Monica, O My Darling' is homage to neo-noir crime comedies: Sikandar Kher
146.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher said his upcoming film 'Monica, O My Darling' is "a homage" to neo-noir crime comedies, which he said isn't a much-explored genre in Bollywood. Talking about the Vasan Bala directorial, Kher said the characters in the film are "so nuanced that one cannot do justice to his part without getting an in-depth understanding of the other [roles]".

147.title: Don't need to criticise Kejriwal every morning & evening: Gambhir
147.article_body: East Delhi BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on being questioned over BJP's messaging in the national capital, said, "Social media politics won't take us anywhere. How much work we do on...ground is how we create...narrative." He added that he doesn't believe there's a need to criticise Delhi CM Kejriwal "every morning and evening". "It's about saving Delhi," he further said.

148.title: Rahul, Priyanka don't give importance to senior party leaders: Cong leader
148.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh said that party leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra don't give importance and time to senior Congress leaders, which is why dissatisfaction is growing within the party. The Print quoted Singh as saying, "Rahul Gandhi needs to learn political manoeuvres and how to address the generation gap in the Congress."

149.title: 16-yr-old girl raped by 6 in MP's Rewa, house of 1 suspect demolished
149.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was gangraped by six persons, including two minor boys, in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district on Saturday, said police. All suspects have been arrested and the house of one of them was demolished, added police. The victim was visiting a temple with her fiancé when the perpetrators took her to a forest and raped her, said police.

150.title: TCS aims to increase Asia-Pacific region headcount by 15%: Report
150.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is planning to grow its headcount by 15% across the Asia-Pacific region within the next year, Bloomberg reported. Girish Ramachandran, TCS' Asia-Pacific President said the company sees wage pressure easing as markets are opening up post the COVID-19 pandemic. The firm hired 1,00,000 consultants last year and will continue to do so, he added.

151.title: Bombay HC orders demolition of illegal construction at minister Narayan Rane's bungalow
151.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday ordered demolition of an unauthorised construction at bungalow of Union Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Narayan Rane, in Mumbai's Juhu. The court has ordered for the structure to be demolished in two weeks and has also imposed a ₹10 lakh fine. BMC had sent notice to Rane's Juhu residence over alleged alterations.

152.title: Will release a fix: Apple after users complain of camera shaking on iPhone 14 Pro
152.article_body: After some users complained of camera shaking and rattling sounds on using third-party apps like Instagram, Snapchat or TikTok on their iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max, Apple has responded. Replying to a publication, Apple said it's "aware of the issue and a fix will be released next week." Some users had shared visuals of the issues on social media.

153.title: After 'Tandav' controversy, we were really sensitive with 'Jogi': Zafar
153.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar, whose last directorial 'Tandav' landed in controversy for hurting religious sentiments, said he was "really sensitive" during the making of 'Jogi'. He said that 'Tandav' had offended people, which he didn't want to happen with his Diljit Dosanjh starrer. "I want to make content which unites the country rather than creating division," Zafar added.

154.title: Apple to raise App Store prices in several countries from October
154.article_body: Apple announced it will soon raise App Store prices, including in-app purchases in several countries such as Japan, Malaysia, Pakistan, Vietnam and every country that uses the euro as its currency. The new prices, which will exclude auto-renewable subscriptions, will be effective from October 5. The price hike in Vietnam is due to new local tax regulations, it said.

155.title: Cities can't be developed with election-centric approach: PM to BJP mayors
155.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, after virtually inaugurating the National Mayors' Conference in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Tuesday, urged all BJP mayors to plan development of cities in a holistic manner. He said the elected representatives should not think of development just in terms of winning elections. "You cannot develop your city with an election-centric approach," PM Modi added.

156.title: Noida women safety unit patrols crowded city places, warning cards issued
156.article_body: The women's safety unit of Noida police on Monday launched an initiative that includes the deployment of officers in crowded places, along with personnel from the bike-borne Swayamsiddha team and anti-Romeo squads. Reports said that the unit checked over 100 spots and that 66 warning cards were issued to people near school and college premises.

157.title: Singer Enrique Iglesias kisses fan during Las Vegas event, shares video
157.article_body: Singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias kissed a fan at an event in Las Vegas. He also shared a video of them kissing on Instagram. In the video, the female fan can be seen taking pictures with the singer, while he kissed her. Iglesias can then be seen moving her aside after a few seconds and walking away from her.

158.title: Only BJP leaders can go among public and say we've worked for you: Nadda
158.article_body: There are a few people who have always done politics in the name of farmers, BJP chief JP Nadda said on Tuesday in Gujarat's Gandhinagar. "BJP has worked to alleviate pain of farmers by understanding them," he added. "I can confidently say that it's just BJP leaders who can go among public and say we've worked for you," he stated.

159.title: 1st multiplex to open in Kashmir today after 30 years
159.article_body: For the first time in about 30 years, a multiplex will be opened in Kashmir today. There will be a special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. According to an official, the Srinagar-based multiplex has three large auditoriums with a seating capacity of over 500 people at a time. Designed by INOX, the auditoriums possess Dolby Atmos digital sound systems.

160.title: 1 arrested in Jharkhand for running over pregnant woman with tractor
160.article_body: A 26-year-old man, identified as Roshan Singh, was arrested in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh following the death of a 27-year-old pregnant woman after a loan recovery agent allegedly ran a tractor over her, police said. A search is on for the other accused in this incident, police added. Roshan is a "third party vendor engaged by a finance company", police stated.

161.title: Jodhpur man beats elderly father with a stick in street, arrested; video surfaces
161.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a man beating up his elderly father with a stick, slapping and punching him in a street in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. The accused was arrested under Section 151 of the CrPC (Code Of Criminal Procedure). Police said that this was not the first time that the man had attacked his father.

162.title: Washing Machine makes the front page: Derek O'Brien on probe agencies
162.article_body: Sharing a news report which said that the percentage of political leaders who came under CBI scanner surged during NDA's rule, TMC's Derek O'Brien compared probe agencies with 'washing machines'. Sharing the front page of a newspaper, he wrote, "Washing Machine makes the front page." "Atrocities for others, favours for your own," SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said sharing the report.

163.title: Nobody needs anybody's nod to contest Congress president polls: Jairam
163.article_body: Following reports that Congress MP Shashi Tharoor received party interim chief Sonia Gandhi's nod to contest the polls for the party's new president, party leader Jairam Ramesh told Hindustan Times, "Nobody needs anybody's nod to contest." He added that anybody who wants to contest can do so and this has been the "consistent position of...Congress president and Rahul Gandhi".

164.title: Natco Pharma stock gains after court's nod for insecticide launch
164.article_body: After Natco Pharma received the Delhi High Court's approval for the launch of chlorantraniliprole, an insecticide and its formulations, through a non-infringing process, its shares gained over 3% intraday on Tuesday. At 11:57 am, its shares were trading 1.39% up at ₹793.65 apiece on the NSE. Its shares touched a 52-week high of ₹942.15 on January 17 this year.

165.title: Sanjay Kapoor auditioned for Salman's role in 'Maine Pyar Kiya': Bhagyashree
165.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that before Salman Khan was finalised for 'Maine Pyar Kiya', actors such as Sanjay Kapoor, Kunal Goswami and Prosenjit Chatterjee had auditioned to play the male lead in the film. Bhagyashree added that director Sooraj Barjatya "was very keen" on casting her as the female lead and she was his "first and last choice".

166.title: Lufthansa responds after user asks 'was Punjab CM Mann deplaned for being drunk'
166.article_body: Lufthansa has responded after a user shared a screenshot of a news claiming Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was deplaned in Frankfurt as he was drunk. "Can you confirm if the Indian was over drunk," the user tweeted. "We do not provide any information regarding individual passengers. Flight departed later than originally planned due to a delayed inbound flight," Lufthansa said.

167.title: Brazil's former President Lula leads over Bolsonaro ahead of election: Poll
167.article_body: Brazilian Presidential candidate Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva holds a lead over President Jair Bolsonaro less than two weeks before the election, an IPEC poll showed. According to the survey, Lula had 47% of voters' support against 31% for Bolsonaro, compared to 46% and 31% respectively, estimated last week. Bolsonaro's disapproval rating has increased to 47% from 45% last week.

168.title: Mumbai man arrested for repeatedly raping minor step-daughter for 2 yrs
168.article_body: Police have arrested a 50-year-old man from Mumbai for allegedly raping his minor step-daughter repeatedly for the past two years. According to police, the girl's biological mother had earlier noticed the abuse and had warned her husband not to repeat it. However, she decided to file an FIR after she caught him sexually assaulting her eldest daughter again.

169.title: Bhagavad Gita to be introduced in K'taka schools soon: BC Nagesh
169.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh on Monday announced that the state government is contemplating the introduction of Bhagavad Gita in schools and colleges from this academic year. He added that the text will be taught as part of the moral education syllabus. "The discussion is ongoing. A committee will be formed and we'll take a decision soon," he further said.

170.title: Crompton Greaves approves 6% stake sale in Butterfly Gandhimathi
170.article_body: Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals approved the sale of around 10.72 lakh equity shares at face value of ₹10 apiece of its material subsidiary Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances. This sale represents up to 6% of its total issued and paid-up equity share capital and will be via an offer for sale. Butterfly Gandhimathi's shares closed at ₹1,506.20 apiece on BSE on Monday.

171.title: All is not well with our world: Priyanka Chopra at UN General Assembly
171.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra addressed the United Nations General Assembly on Monday, saying, "As we all know, all is not well with our world." She spoke about the effects of COVID-19, climate crisis and the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Priyanka also shared videos and photos from the event including a picture with Malala Yousafzai, Amanda Gorman, Somaya Faruqi and Judith Hill.

172.title: J&K Congress passes resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as party President
172.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential election, the Jammu and Kashmir unit of the party passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress chief again. Various state units including Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Bihar and Tamil Nadu have already passed the resolution backing the Wayanad MP. The election for the Congress President is set to be held on October 17.

173.title: Majority verdict by larger bench will prevail: Supreme Court
