173.article_body: The Supreme Court has ruled that a majority verdict by a larger bench will prevail over a unanimous decision by a bench of lesser strength. Although the number of judges constituting the majority on the larger bench may be less than or equal to the number of judges on the smaller bench.

174.title: 5 killed in Iran during protests over woman's death in custody: Rights group
174.article_body: At least five people were killed in Iran on Monday after security forces opened fire during protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman in police custody, a Kurdish rights group said. Mahsa Amini fell into a coma last week, hours after morality police held her for allegedly breaking hijab rules. Reportedly, a number of protesters had been arrested .

175.title: You've to be glam with Karan, or he won't call you on 'Koffee With Karan': Gauri
175.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, who will feature in the upcoming episode of 'Koffee With Karan', stated that she was looking forward to getting ready. "You have to be glam when you are with Karan (Johar), otherwise he won't take you on his show," she added. Gauri further said Karan has never asked her to appear on the show.

176.title: Alleged gas leak causes fire during cremation in Punjab; 22 hurt
176.article_body: At least 22 people suffered burn injuries after an alleged gas leak during a man's cremation at an electric crematorium caused a fire to spread in Punjab's Moga on Monday. A former village sarpanch said that the man's family and some villagers were standing near the crematorium. Of those injured, three people were admitted to civil hospital, a doctor said.

177.title: Should've apologised immediately: Faisal on Aamir's intolerance remark
177.article_body: Talking about Aamir Khan's statement on intolerance in 2015, his brother Faisal Khan said, "He should have apologised immediately after that thing came out, not when...'Laal Singh Chaddha' was releasing." "That seems opportunistic," added Faisal. "There is no harm in...correcting yourself," he stated. Discussing 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Faisal said, "Aamir should have selected a better script."

178.title: Custodial torture: Owaisi after beards of Muslim inmates shaved in MP
178.article_body: Five Muslim prisoners in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh jail have alleged that the jail authorities forcibly shaved their beards off. According to a prisoner, the jailer asked him, "Are you from Pakistan?" before shaving his beard. AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi called the incident "custodial torture and a violation of Article 25". The jailer, NS Rana, has denied the allegations.

179.title: 3 arrested for smuggling drugs via social media in Greater Noida
179.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested three people for allegedly smuggling drugs and supplying them to college students across the country, including in Noida and Greater Noida. The accused reportedly did business through social media and traded in cryptocurrency to evade identification. They were arrested after the DCP posed as a buyer and lured them into coming to Greater Noida.

180.title: Child abduction messages on social media fake: Mumbai Police
180.article_body: The Mumbai Police said that news circulating on social media of children getting kidnapped from places like Vikhroli and Ghatkopar are all fake and asked people not to believe in such rumours. Senior officials visited the sites mentioned in the fake messages, conducted a probe in the areas and found all these news to be fake, DCP Prashant Kadam said.

181.title: BJP is well-oiled machinery in Gujarat: AAP's Raghav Chadha
181.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha, who has been appointed co-incharge of the party's Gujarat unit, said that BJP in Gujarat is a well-oiled machinery with unlimited muscle, media and money power. "All media outlets have been given directions to blackout AAP...We understand that with BJP, no election is a level playing field, but this is at a different level," he added.

182.title: FIR against Pune man for posing as Maha CM in photo with gangster Mohol
182.article_body: A man from Pune's Ambegaon was booked for allegedly posing as Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde in a photograph with gangster Sharad Mohol, police said. This comes after a sub-inspector of the crime branch filed a complaint against the accused at the Bundgarden Police Station, police added. The photograph with Mohol maligned Shinde's image, police further said.

183.title: ICC releases list of new rules to be introduced in international cricket from October 1
183.article_body: The ICC released list of new rules that will be introduced in international cricket from October 1. Among the new rules, an incoming batter will be required to be ready to take strike within two minutes in Tests and ODIs. New batters will face next delivery after player is out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken.

184.title: First images of Mars captured by the world's most powerful telescope released
184.article_body: The NASA has shared first images of Mars captured by James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. A close-up photo of Mars reveals surface features such as Huygens Crater, dark volcanic Syrtis Major, and Hellas Basin. A 'heat map' showing the light being given off by Mars as it loses heat was also captured by the telescope.

185.title: Zomato delivery agent molests woman on pretext of asking for water in Pune
185.article_body: A Zomato food delivery agent was arrested for allegedly molesting a woman in Pune. The 19-year-old woman alleged that the 40-year-old delivery executive asked for water upon delivering her food. When she gave him water, he pulled her close and allegedly kissed her on her cheeks, she told the police.

186.title: Does Virat Kohli's ton as opener create more of a problem?: Ponting
186.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's 71st international hundred, which he scored recently as an opener, Ricky Ponting said, "Does that create more of a problem than we thought?" "What are we going to do...going into...T20 World Cup 2022?" added Ponting. Reacting to people stating that Kohli should open in T20 World Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir recently said, "Don't start this nonsense."

187.title: Shashi Tharoor, Ashok Gehlot likely contenders for Cong chief: Report
187.article_body: Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Ashok Gehlot have emerged as the likely contenders for the post of the party's president, as per media reports. Tharoor has reportedly got the nod to contest from interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi. Gehlot is a supporter of the Gandhi family and has reportedly been trying to persuade Rahul Gandhi to run for the post.

188.title: Scientists create world's first cloned wild Arctic wolf; pics go viral
188.article_body: A wild Arctic wolf was successfully cloned for the first time in the world by scientists at a Beijing-based gene firm. "After two years of painstaking efforts, the Arctic wolf was cloned successfully," Global Times quoted Beijing-based Sinogene Biotechnology Co's general manager Mi Jidong as saying. The wolf named Maya is in good health, according to the company.

189.title: Fortuner car hits multiple vehicles, drags man for 100 metres in Delhi; video surfaces
189.article_body: A Toyota Fortuner car crashed into several parked vehicles and hit a 19-year-old man on a two-wheeler, dragging him for around 100 metres in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Monday evening. The incident was caught on a CCTV camera. Police said the Fortuner's driver was caught and they have sent him for a medical examination to ascertain if he was drunk.

190.title: They wouldn't have sat me back there: Trump on Biden's pic at Queen's funeral
190.article_body: Commenting on a pic showing US President Joe Biden placed 14 rows behind King Charles III at Queen's funeral, Donald Trump wrote, "If I were president, they wouldn't have sat me back there – and our country would be much different than it's right now!" "This is what's happened to America in just two short years. No respect!" he added.

191.title: Sonia gives nod to Tharoor to contest Congress President polls: Reports
191.article_body: According to reports, Congress interim chief Sonia Gandhi has given the nod to MP Shashi Tharoor to contest for the party's President post. "Shashi Tharoor reached out to Sonia Gandhi in a meeting...and said that he can make internal democracy stronger. Sonia replied that he (Shashi Tharoor) can contest if he wants. Anybody can contest elections," said the sources.

192.title: Himachal Congress passes resolution authorising Sonia to choose party chief
192.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress passed a resolution authorising interim President Sonia Gandhi to choose the next National President of the party. The resolution also enables Sonia to nominate the new state Congress chief and AICC members. "We passed the resolution in the presence of all the delegates...and everyone extended their support for this," state Congress chief Pratibha Singh said.

193.title: Non-BJP front not possible without Congress' inclusion: Sharad Pawar
193.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday said a non-BJP front will only be possible with the inclusion of the Congress party. Pawar further stated that he has met Opposition leaders, including Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, who expressed their views on forming a non-BJP front. But, no planning has been done yet, he added.

194.title: AAP begins 'selfie with kooda' campaign on landfills issue before MCD polls
194.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party has started 'selfie with kooda' campaign to highlight the issue of waste and landfills. The party has also started another campaign named 'BJP ka chamatkaar dekho, koode ka pahad dekho'. Senior AAP leader Dilip Pandey said, "Our slogan is kooda, kachra aur corruption, inme BJP hai number one."

195.title: 1.8 tons of cocaine worth $278 million seized in Nigeria
195.article_body: Authorities in Nigeria have seized 1.8 tons of cocaine which has an estimated street value of $278 million. According to the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, the cocaine, recovered from a warehouse in Lagos, was to be sold to customers in Europe and Asia. At least four people believed to be members of an international drug syndicate have been arrested.

196.title: Man hiding 1 kg gold in stomach caught at Kerala's Karipur airport
196.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested after allegedly getting caught carrying 1.063 kg gold in his stomach at the Karipur airport in Kerala on Monday. He tried to hide the gold inside four capsules. After the police could not find the gold on his body, an X-ray was conducted, which revealed the four capsules containing gold inside his stomach.

197.title: Boundary wall collapses in Noida's Jalvayu Vihar society, 4 dead
197.article_body: At least four persons were killed as a boundary wall in Jalvayu Vihar society in Noida's Sector 21 collapsed on Tuesday morning. "Noida Authority had given a contract for drainage repair work...We've been told when labourers were pulling out bricks, the wall collapsed," Noida DM Suhas LY said. "Police and Fire Department teams are present at the spot," he added.

198.title: Experience 'Mobile Dhamaka' this Amazon Great Indian Festival: Amazon
198.article_body: With the Amazon Great Indian Festival around the corner, Amazon has hinted towards a 'Mobile Dhamaka', with 5G smartphones starting at just ₹11,999. Amazon is also offering Amazon Pay rewards worth ₹1,500 and a free screen replacement, with total additional benefits up to ₹2,300, it said. The festival will be live from September 23.

199.title: Two policemen booked in Maha over impersonation in LLB written exam
199.article_body: A sub-divisional police officer and a constable have been booked in Maharashtra's Jalna over alleged impersonation in a written exam for LLB. The constable appeared in place of the SDPO for the exam held at Bhakt College in February 2020 while the latter was reportedly on official duty. A probe began after an activist submitted a complaint against the two.

200.title: Russia claims Ottawa embassy was attacked; summons Canadian envoy
200.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Monday summoned the Canadian ambassador and issued a protest over attacks on the Russian embassy in Ottawa. The ministry claimed that an unknown person threw a Molotov cocktail onto the grounds of the Russian embassy in Ottawa on September 12. It also said "aggressive" protestors had blocked an entrance to the consular section of the embassy.

201.title: 'Laal Singh...' was not a wow film: Aamir's brother Faisal Khan
201.article_body: Aamir Khan's brother Faisal Khan said 'Laal Singh Chaddha' was not a "wow film". He said he liked the film "in parts, but not completely". "With Aamir and other good actors, you expect them to do too good work. They should blow your mind. But that didn't happen with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', unfortunately," he added.

202.title: We will not allow ideology of BJP, RSS to divide our country: Rahul Gandhi
202.article_body: Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP spreads hatred and violence, adding that we will not allow the ideology of RSS to divide our country. He was addressing Congress workers on Monday as part of the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala's Cherthala. "Do you think a divided society can build hospitals, roads and can educate our children?" he added.

203.title: SpaceX test-fires record 7 engines on Super Heavy Booster 7; video surfaces
203.article_body: SpaceX test-fired seven engines on Starship Super Heavy prototype 'Booster 7', marking the highest number of its new Raptor engines ever tested at the same time. Commenting on a video of the test, CEO Elon Musk said the chamber pressures on all the seven engines "looked good". He added SpaceX will fire all 33 engines in a few weeks.

204.title: 3 men thrashed for objecting to public drinking in Gurugram
204.article_body: Three men were allegedly assaulted in Gurugram's Sector 38 after they objected to two men drinking on their car's bonnet, the police said. The police further informed that they received a call from one of the injured persons who said that a group of around 15 men was assaulting him and his friends outside a liquor shop.

205.title: Richa Chadha to wear her family’s heirloom pieces for wedding: Report
205.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha is reportedly wearing her family's heirloom pieces for her wedding, which is said to be taking place on October 6. The actress is also getting some hand-me-down pieces from her grandmother to be reworked for her D-Day. As per a report, Richa's wedding jewellery is inspired by the royal aesthetics of Rajasthan.

206.title: Putting lots of lights, extra sparkle; looking forward to it: Gauri on Diwali
206.article_body: While talking about Diwali 2022, Gauri Khan said that she is looking forward to it this year. "Well, we haven't started yet but yes, decorating the house and putting loads of lights and an extra sparkle," she said, adding, "I think, in festivals, you look forward to just the family being together and celebrating something and looking forward to something."

207.title: Need to feel proud of our history, we can't be China, Russia or USA: RSS chief
207.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said India needs to retain its essence and identity by embracing its scriptures and ancient history. "There's a need to read and feel proud of our scriptures and history...create a narrative based on them. We cannot be China, Russia or USA. We cannot call it progress, rather we would become a laughing stock," Bhagwat added.

208.title: Odisha's Nandankanan zoo planning to bring 2 cheetahs from Dubai
208.article_body: The authorities at the Nandankanan Zoological Park in Odisha's Bhubaneswar are planning to bring two cheetahs from Dubai. They will be brought as part of an animal exchange programme between the zoo and the Dubai Safari Park. The authorities are also planning to bring five African white lions and chimpanzees in exchange for Manipur brow-antlered deer, hippopotamuses and blackbucks.

209.title: Malaika-Amrita's show 'Arora Sisters' to feature Arbaaz & Arjun: Report
209.article_body: Malaika Arora and Amrita Arora's upcoming show 'Arora Sisters' will reportedly feature Arjun Kapoor and Arbaaz Khan. As per a report, Arjun and Arbaaz will feature in different episodes of the show, which is said to be a peek into the personal and professional lives of Arora siblings. While Malaika is currently dating Arjun Kapoor, she divorced Arbaaz in 2017.

210.title: New back pain test helped 10,000+ people avoid spine surgery: QI Spine
210.article_body: QI Spine shared that a team of spine specialists has found a breakthrough in the treatment of back pain without surgery called Digital Spine Analysis (DSA) to accurately identify the weak areas in the back & neck. QI Spine combines the experience of 300+ doctors, backed by data intelligence aiming to offer the most accurate diagnosis.

211.title: What are you, Karan: Kangana on reports of Brahmastra beating 'The Kashmir...'
211.article_body: While sharing filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri's tweet about 'Brahmastra' beating 'The Kashmir Files' at the box office, actress Kangana Ranaut asked, "What are you Karan Johar ji". "The audacity to belittle The Kashmir Files, a film made on Hindu genocide (and) also trying to ride on its success," she wrote on her Instagram Stories.

212.title: News of me being injured in stone pelting incident in Kashmir is inaccurate: Emraan
212.article_body: Following reports of stone pelting at a film crew in Kashmir, Emraan Hashmi said, "The news of me being injured in a stone pelting incident is inaccurate." Emraan is currently shooting for Marathi filmmaker Tejas Vijay Deoskar's Ground Zero in Kashmir. However, Emraan neither confirmed nor denied whether the incident happened with his film crew.

213.title: Spider spotted on Queen Elizabeth's coffin during her funeral, video goes viral
213.article_body: A video of a spider crawling on top of Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral service on Monday went viral online. The spider was spotted on the handwritten note, penned by King Charles III for the Queen, placed upon the coffin. "Most famous spider in world right now," a user said, while another wrote, "God save the Royal Spider."

214.title: Queen's horse Emma bids farewell to late monarch at Windsor Castle, pic surfaces
214.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's horse, Carltonlima Emma, bid farewell to the late monarch as her coffin processed through Windsor Castle on Monday. The horse was accompanied by Terry Pendry, the Queen’s head groom, who has held the position for the past 25 years. The Stud Groom bowed his head as the State Hearse passed by, while Emma stood by his side.

215.title: Police team attacked, constable's uniform torn in Gurugram; 1 arrested
215.article_body: A man from Gurugram's Palra village was arrested for attacking police and tearing a constable's uniform for asking him to stop creating ruckus. The incident occurred on Sunday when police went to the accused's house responding to a call of a domestic row. According to Head Constable Amir Singh, the accused also threatened to kill the officers before being arrested.

216.title: K'taka hijab ban part of pattern to marginalise minorities: Petitioner to SC
216.article_body: Petitioners who challenged the hijab ban in Karnataka educational institutes told the Supreme Court that the ban shows "a pattern to marginalise the minority community". The petitioner further stated that hijab is part of their identity, asking if wearing it threatens the unity or integrity of the country. "That nobody is saying...Even the [High Court] judgment doesn't say," SC stated.

217.title: Adani Group to double cement making capacity to 140 mn tonnes in 5 yrs
217.article_body: Adani Group is planning to double its cement manufacturing capacity to 140 million tonnes in next five years. Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said he saw a multifold rise in cement demand in India. Last week, Adani Group completed its $6.5 billion acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC. Adani Group has cement production capacity of 70 million tonnes per annum.

218.title: Central investigation agencies can open offices at my home: Bihar Dy CM
218.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said that central investigation agencies including CBI, Enforcement Directorate and Income Tax are free to open their offices at his home. This comes two days after the CBI moved a Delhi court seeking the cancellation of bail granted to Tejashwi in the IRCTC scam. "BJP is scared of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections," he added.

219.title: US engineer freed by Taliban in exchange for Afghan drug trafficker
219.article_body: The Taliban on Monday released a US engineer in exchange for an Afghan tribal leader detained by the US in 2005 over drug charges. The US Navy veteran Mark Frerichs, who was taken hostage in 2020, was exchanged at Kabul airport for Bashir Noorzai. US President Joe Biden said that the swap required "difficult decisions" that he didn't take lightly.

220.title: 56-year-old man moves Delhi HC to ensure family doesn't perform last rites
220.article_body: A 56-year-old man with cardiac ailments approached Delhi High Court to prevent his wife, daughter or son-in-law from performing his last rites. He claimed his family treated him with cruelty and he wasn't even invited to his daughter's wedding. He wants his body to be handed over to a man who took care of him and is "like his son".

221.title: 47-year-old man falls before moving metro train in Noida, dies
221.article_body: A 47-year-old man died after he fell before a moving metro train at Noida's Golf Course Metro Station on Monday. The bystanders said that the man had jumped in front of the train, an ACP stated. However, a senior police officer said that the man's wife claimed that he had gone to check the train when he slipped and fell.

222.title: Car falls into canal in Pune; driver & passenger manage to come out
222.article_body: A car fell into a canal at night in Pune's Hadapsar after the driver lost control of the vehicle, according to fire brigade officials. However, the driver and a passenger who was in the car managed to come out as the canal didn't have much water. The car was pulled out of the canal using a crane service.

223.title: Unseen photo of Queen Elizabeth II hiking released after her burial
223.article_body: The Royal Family has released a previously unseen photo of the Queen after her private burial took place. The photo of the Queen was taken at Balmoral in 1971 and shows her hiking in the moorlands surrounding the castle in Scotland. The image was shared on social media with the caption, "May flights of Angels sing thee to thy rest."

224.title: EC proposes lowering anonymous donation limit, cap cash donations: Reports
224.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) has proposed bringing down anonymous donations to political parties from ₹20,000 to ₹2,000, as per reports. The EC has further proposed to cap cash donations at 20% or a maximum of ₹20 crore, reports added. The poll body has reportedly also recommended that each candidate open a separate bank account for election purposes.

225.title: Karnataka man tells wife he will marry another, gives triple talaq
225.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly giving triple talaq to his 29-year-old wife on the premises of a court, where they came for a domestic abuse case hearing. He told his wife that he was marrying another woman and was giving talaq to her as per Sharia. The woman had accused her husband of assault over dowry.

226.title: BJP got booking of 13 venues for Kejriwal's event in Gujarat cancelled: AAP
226.article_body: The AAP in Gujarat alleged that BJP has got bookings of 13 venues in Vadodara cancelled by threatening the owners to ensure that its national convener Arvind Kejriwal's programme cannot be held there. AAP leader Isudan Gadhvi further alleged that "corrupt BJP" has been preventing our spokespersons from debate by threatening TV media. BJP is now rattled, Gadhvi added.

227.title: Monsoon caused damage of ₹3,600 cr in K'taka this year: CM Bommai
227.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai informed that monsoon this year caused a damage to the tune of ₹3,600 crore to the crops, houses and infrastructure in the state. He further informed that the state would claim ₹1,645 crore from the Centre under the National Disaster Relief Fund. "More than 10.06-lakh hectare of agricultural land and 42,048 houses were damaged," he added.

228.title: Uber blames teenage hacking group Lapsus$ for recent security breach
228.article_body: Uber said that a hacker associated with the Lapsus$ hacking group was to blame for a breach of its internal systems last week and reiterated that no customer data was compromised during the attack. Said to be composed largely of teenagers, Lapsus$ has targeted companies like Samsung, Microsoft, Vodafone and Nvidia in the past.

229.title: I'm not Ranveer Singh, I still don't get to choose a film: Aparshakti
229.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana said in an interview that he still doesn't have opportunities to pick or choose a film, adding, "I am no Ranveer Singh yet." He further said the audience decides how an actor will be. "They decided Tiger Shroff is an action hero, Ranbir Kapoor is a romantic hero and Ayushmann Khurrana will do content-driven films," Aparshakti added.

230.title: TRS govt on ventilator, will collapse soon: Telangana BJP chief
230.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Monday criticised CM K Chandrashekar Rao-led state government over the dumping yard issue in Medchal-Malkajgiri district's Jawahar Nagar. "TRS government is on...ventilator and the government will collapse," he said. "The dumping yard issue is affecting...public's health. Give the power to BJP. We'll see how the...problem is solved," Kumar added.

231.title: 2 house burglaries reported in Pune, gold worth ₹18.80 lakh stolen
231.article_body: Two separate cases of house break-in were reported at different residential societies in Pune. In one incident, the suspects entered a house while the resident was away and made off with  ₹5.40 lakh cash and gold ornaments worth ₹1.6 lakh. In the other case, ₹4.28 lakh cash and gold ornaments worth ₹17.20 lakh were stolen.

232.title: Burglars steal phones worth ₹6 lakh while 5 guards slept in Punjab
232.article_body: Six unidentified burglars stole 26 phones worth ₹6 lakh from a showroom in Punjab's Ludhiana on Monday. The showroom didn't have a shutter and all the five security guards who were deputed there were found asleep when the incident occurred. The incident was caught on CCTV cameras and shows the burglars entering shop at 5 am while the guards slept.

233.title: India reports 4,043 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate now at 1.37%
233.article_body: India reported 4,043 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 4,858 COVID-19 cases. Meanwhile, 4,676 recoveries were recorded across India in the last 24 hours. The active cases in the country now stand at 47,379. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.37%.

234.title: Delhi's Chandni Chowk redevelopment project to begin soon
234.article_body: The Delhi government is planning to revive and beautify the historical architectural buildings in the Chandni Chowk area. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia held a meeting with officials from various departments and discussed the plan for the second phase of the redevelopment project. The first phase of the redevelopment project was completed on September 12, 2021.

235.title: 11 killed due to lightning in 3 districts of Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
235.article_body: As many as 11 persons were killed due to lightning in three districts of Bihar, four each in Purnia and Araria and three in Supaul. CM Nitish Kumar announced a ₹4 lakh ex-gratia each for the deceased's families. "Be careful in bad weather. Follow the suggestions issued by the Disaster Management Department to (protect yourself) from thunderstorms," Bihar CM tweeted.

236.title: Should buy a lot of cars: BJP leader on Kamal Nath's 'lend my car' remark
236.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya reacted to MP Congress chief Kamal Nath's remark where he said his party wouldn't stop anyone from quitting and that he would lend his car if any member wants to go and join BJP. "Then he should buy a lot of cars. There are a lot of people not happy with his leadership," Vijayvargiya said.

237.title: Sensex gains 600 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
237.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Tuesday with the Sensex up 600 points at 59,761 points and Nifty gaining 164.20 points to 17,786.50 points. Hindalco Industries, IndusInd Bank, Tata Motors, Bajaj Finserv and Tech Mahindra were among the significant Nifty gainers. All sectoral indices opened in the green with Nifty IT and Nifty Media topping the charts.

238.title: World chess champ Carlsen resigns after just 1 move against Niemann, sparks controversy
238.article_body: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen resigned after just one move against US' 19-year-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann in Julius Baer Generation online tournament, sparking controversy. Earlier this month, Carlsen quit $500,000 Sinquefield Cup after losing to Niemann. He had confirmed withdrawal by posting video of a quote by football manager Jose Mourinho, reading, "If I speak, I'm in big trouble."

239.title: New Zealand announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
239.article_body: New Zealand have announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022. Pacer Trent Boult and all-rounder Jimmy Neesham, who recently declined a central contract, find a place in the squad. Further, opener Martin Guptill will feature in his seventh T20 World Cup. Kane Williamson will lead New Zealand for the third time in the T20 World Cup.

240.title: Audience gets I'm not saying all Britishers are villains: Rajamouli on RRR
240.article_body: While talking about ‘RRR’ working in the UK despite showing “British in poor light”, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said that the audience understands. “If a British is playing the villain, they understand that I am not saying all the Britishers are villains," he said, adding, "In this film, a particular guy is a villain and a particular guy is a hero."

241.title: Delhi Police busts fake passport and visa racket
241.article_body: The Delhi Police busted a fake visa racket that conned people on the pretext of sending them to foreign countries and arranging the required travel documents such as passports and visas. One of the three masterminds involved in the racket has been arrested. The police seized 19 forged passports, 26 forged visas and over 165 immigration stamps of different countries.

242.title: 5 plastic carry bag manufacturing units shut down, fined in Punjab
242.article_body: The Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) has shut down five plastic bag manufacturing units and imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh on each of them following raids. The state power distribution company has also been asked to cut the power supply to these industrial units. "More inspections will be carried out in future," PPCB chief engineer in Ludhiana said.

243.title: I was caged at Aamir's house: Brother Faissal Khan
243.article_body: Talking about turning down an offer to appear in the upcoming season of the reality show Bigg Boss, Aamir Khan's brother Faissal said participating in the show would be akin to being caged. He further said that he has already been caged once before in Aamir's house, and would not want to sacrifice his freedom at any cost.

244.title: Reconstruction on Mumbai's 150-yr-old Carnac Bridge to start by Nov
244.article_body: The reconstruction of 150-year-old British-era Carnac Bridge in Mumbai will start in the next two months. The length of the new bridge will be 70 metres and the width 26.5 metres, while the estimated cost is around ₹53.08 crores, as per report. The BMC has set a deadline to complete the reconstruction of the bridge by June 2024.

245.title: I worked in banks for 9 years, it was a very bad mistake: Ashneer Grover
245.article_body: BharatPe’s ex-MD Ashneer Grover said it took him nine years to figure out that he wanted to become an entrepreneur. "I worked in banks for nine years...it was a very bad mistake," said Grover. He added that he aspired to get to a certain standard in life, but once he did, he started to feel his job was suffocating him.

246.title: 'Tiranga' is my attempt to keep doing disruptive content: Parineeti
246.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra said her upcoming film 'Code Name: Tiranga' will present her in a "whole new avatar". She said the film, which features her as a RAW agent, is an attempt to keep pushing her boundaries as a performer and do "disruptive content". "I can assure you that we intend to shock and awe with this film," she added.

247.title: BJP wants a handful of people to control entire country: Rahul Gandhi
247.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that BJP wants to build a country where a handful of people control the entire country. "Because of this, millions and millions of people are drowning in poverty, youngsters can't dream of being employed," Gandhi added while addressing a public program during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala's Alappuzha.

248.title: Mexico's foreign minister tweets selfie with wife at Queen's funeral; criticised
248.article_body: Mexico's foreign minister was criticised after he posted a selfie with his wife from Queen Elizabeth's funeral in London on Monday. Tweeting the photo, Marcelo Ebrard wrote, "At the State Funeral of HM Queen Elizabeth II." A Twitter user commented, “You're not at a birthday party to be taking selfies," while another wrote, "He is [a] typical tourist".

249.title: KPSC aspirants hold protest in Bengaluru over delay in results
249.article_body: Many government job aspirants gathered at Bengaluru's Freedom park on Monday to protest against the delay in results of exams conducted by Karnataka Public Service Commission (KPSC). They demanded a provisional schedule of each examination to be published along with the notification. They also sought a UPSC-like annual schedule of events to be published.

250.title: Russian military firm trying to recruit 1,500 felons for Ukraine war: US
250.article_body: The Russian private military company, the Wagner Group,  is trying to recruit over 1,500 convicted felons to take part in Russia's war in Ukraine, but many are refusing to join, a senior US defence official told reporters. "Our information indicates that Wagner has been suffering high losses in Ukraine, especially and unsurprisingly among young and inexperienced fighters," the official added.

251.title: NSE adds Delta Corp and Escorts Kubota to today's F&O ban list
251.article_body: The NSE has added Delta Corp and Escorts Kubota to its Futures and Options (F&O) ban list for Tuesday after the scrips crossed 95% of the market-wide position limit. On Monday, Delta Corp fell 4.6% while Escorts Kubota rose 8% to end at ₹2,086. Indiabulls Housing Finance, India Cements, PVR and RBL Bank are already on the F&O ban list.

252.title: Supreme Court stays dismissal of IPS officer who probed Ishrat Jahan encounter
252.article_body: Supreme Court granted a week's stay on the Centre's dismissal order of Satish Chandra Verma, an IPS officer who assisted CBI in its investigation into the Ishrat Jahan encounter case in Gujarat. "It's for the High Court to consider...whether the order of stay...be continued beyond a week," SC said. This comes after Delhi HC stayed the dismissal till September 19.

253.title: Pushing myself out of comfort zone with 'Guns & Gulaabs': Dulquer
253.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said he has pushed himself out of his comfort zone for his upcoming series 'Guns & Gulaabs'. The Raj & DK directorial also stars Rajkummar Rao and Adarsh Gourav. "It is set in this imaginary town, and all these characters - what brings us together - I think it will be a fun ride," Dulquer added.

254.title: TMT to introduce over 100 electric buses in Thane
254.article_body: The Thane Municipal Transport Undertaking (TMT) is planning to introduce over 100 state-of-the-art electric buses in the city. An order for 123 e-buses has been given to Olectra Greentech Limited (OLECTRA) and Evey Trans Private Limited (EVEY) consortium, which will deliver them in nine months. Of the total buses, 71 will be air-conditioned (AC) while the rest will be non-AC.

255.title: 'Baahubali' is the only film I've seen of hers: Bhandarkar on Tamannaah
255.article_body: Director Madhur Bhandarkar said 'Baahubali' is the only film he has seen of his 'Babli Bouncer' actress Tamannaah Bhatia. "For me, when I met her, I just surrendered to the vision and followed my instincts. And she is definitely a director's actress," he said. The director added Tamannaah has performed "flawlessly" in 'Babli Bouncer' and called her "an amazing talent".

256.title: After Gulistan, BMC to demolish another illegal apartment in Mumbai
256.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will soon demolish an illegally constructed 10-storey building in Mumbai's Pydhonie region. The arrangements for demolition of the building, which has 88 flats and 18 shops, at Ibrahim Rahimtulla Marg on Masjid Street in Bhendi Bazaar have started. This comes days after BMC started demolishing the illegally-built Gulistan Apartments.

257.title: 5 people attack constable after argument over parking issue in Pune
257.article_body: Five people were booked for allegedly attacking a police constable over a parking issue in Pune. The incident occurred when one of the accused and the constable got into a heated argument after the former asked the constable to remove his parked car so that he could park his two-wheeler. The accused attacked constable with paver blocks, officials said.

258.title: Pizza Hut now has pizzas starting at ₹79* only
258.article_body: Pizza Hut announced it's giving everyone the perfect reason to say "Shut Up and Take My Money" with its new Flavour Fun range of 12 pizzas starting at ₹79* only. Targeted at Gen Z who’re on a budget, this range has 5 craveable sauces and multiple veg and non-veg toppings, available at 700+ Pizza Hut restaurants and app, it added.

259.title: President Droupadi Murmu shares pics from Queen Elizabeth's funeral
259.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu attended the state funeral of Queen Elizabeth II at Westminster Abbey, London, on Monday. The President of India's official Twitter account shared photos from the event. President Murmu, who was on a three-day visit to the UK, also met Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and President of Tanzania Samia Suluhu Hassan as she attended the Queen's funeral.

260.title: Farmer dies by suicide in Pune, leaves note urging PM to ensure MSP
260.article_body: A 42-year-old farmer allegedly died by suicide in Pune's Junnar tehsil over not getting the Minimum Support Price (MSP), police said. The deceased left behind a note purportedly urging PM Narendra Modi to ensure guaranteed MSP for crops. "The farmer had grown onions...the crop failed to fetch a satisfactory price, he stored the produce worth ₹1.5-2 lakh," police added.

261.title: 24-yr-old man killed, 1 injured after speeding car hits bike in Chandigarh
261.article_body: A 24-year-old man was killed and another man was injured after a speeding car hit the motorcycle they were travelling on in Chandigarh. The incident took place on Sunday. Reports said that the deceased was riding pillion on the motorcycle. The investigators said that they have not been able to identify the car that hit the motorcycle.

262.title: 6 children killed after Myanmar army helicopters fire on school: Reports
262.article_body: At least six children were killed and 17 others were wounded after army helicopters shot at a school in northcentral Myanmar, local media and residents said on Monday. The military said it opened fire because rebels were using the building to attack its forces. Myanmar has been gripped by violence since the military overthrew the civilian government in February 2021.

263.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai visits Indian Embassy in the US, envoy shares pics
263.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai recently visited the Indian Embassy in US, where he held discussions with Indian envoy Taranjit Singh Sandhu. Sharing pictures on Twitter, Sandhu wrote, "Delighted to receive...Pichai...at the Embassy today. Exchanged thoughts on expanding India-US commercial, knowledge & tech partnership." Pichai is reportedly the first Indian-American tech CEO to visit the embassy.

264.title: Ambulance hits bike, runs over 2 pedestrians in Ghaziabad; 3 dead
264.article_body: Three people have died after a speeding ambulance allegedly hit a bike on which a woman was travelling with her son and grandson and then ran over two pedestrians who approached the ambulance to help them in Ghaziabad. The deceased include the two pedestrians and the woman. The ambulance driver was reportedly in an inebriated state.

265.title: Delhi Police head constable shoots self dead inside police station
265.article_body: A 47-year-old Delhi Police head constable died by suicide inside the Prasad Nagar Police Station on Monday morning, police said. The deceased, a warrant branch in-charge, shot himself with a service pistol, police added. The head constable had held a video call with his family before he took the step, police further said.

266.title: Princess Charlotte tells brother George to bow as Queen's coffin passes by; video viral
266.article_body: A video showing Princess Charlotte telling her elder brother Prince George, who is second-in-line to the throne, that he has to bow as Queen's coffin passes by has gone viral on social media. Charlotte, 7, and George, 9, attended the funeral services at both Westminster Abbey and St George's chapel in Windsor with their family.

267.title: COO of US-based Beyond Meat bites a man's nose after fight in garage; arrested
267.article_body: The COO of a plant-based meat company in the US was arrested after he allegedly bit a man's nose during an incident of road rage on Saturday. Beyond Meat's COO, Doug Ramsey, got into a quarrel in a parking garage in Arkansas following a college football game and "ripped" the driver's tip of the nose and "threatened to kill him".

268.title: Mark Zuckerberg loses $71 billion this year, drops 14 spots in world's richest list
268.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has seen his fortune halve by $71 billion so far this year to $55.9 billion. The 38-year-old has dropped 14 spots in list of world's richest people to 20th position, his lowest since 2014. Notably, Zuckerberg was world's third-richest person in July 2021 and his wealth swelled to a peak of $142 billion in September 2021.

269.title: Bengaluru reports 140 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
269.article_body: Bengaluru reported 140 new COVID-19 infections on Monday, taking the cumulative total to 18,70,254 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,410, while the infection positivity rate stood at 1.69%.

270.title: 5-yr-old forced to return peacock feathers from Hyd park, mom writes letter
270.article_body: The mother of a five-year-old boy, who was made to return peacock feathers that he had collected from Hyderabad's KBR National Park, wrote a letter to Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao. "This letter from the mother of a young child was touching...I request KBR park authorities to make an exemption only...for kids when they are carrying feathers," Rao said.

271.title: I'd lose cool, had to try to be mom, dad: Rahul on parenting after wife's death
271.article_body: Actor Rahul Dev, while talking about raising his son after his wife's death, said that there were times when he'd lose his cool. "I had to try to be both mom and dad...It's very painful...It looks easy in films, so many times films show that someone became a widower. But starting again is not easy at all," he added.

272.title: Queen Elizabeth II buried at Windsor Castle in UK
272.article_body: Britain's longest-serving monarch, Queen Elizabeth II, was on Monday buried at King George VI Memorial Chapel in Windsor Castle in Berkshire, in a private family burial. Her remains were brought to her final resting place from Westminster Abbey in London after a state funeral. The Queen has been interred next to her family including her late husband Prince Philip.

273.title: 3 Iranian cargo planes to be added to export violation list: US
273.article_body: Three Boeing 747 planes operated by Iranian carriers will be added by the US Commerce Department to the list of planes suspected of violating its export controls. The department said it believes the planes are being used to provide cargo services to Russia. The export controls are part of US sanctions imposed against Russia for invading Ukraine, the department added.

274.title: May pull out of ruling NPP-led alliance in Meghalaya: BJP leader
274.article_body: Senior BJP leader Alexander L Hek said the party may withdraw support from the NPP-led alliance running the Meghalaya government soon. "Everything would be disclosed and explained...at an appropriate time," said Hek about the reasons behind the move. Reports claim the BJP is miffed after its state Vice President Bernard N Marak was arrested for allegedly running a brothel.

275.title: Forces in Karnataka using it as communal laboratory: Kerala CM
275.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said certain forces in Karnataka were turning it into a "communal laboratory". "There have been a lot of efforts to saffronise the next generation and textbooks are being used as a tool," said Vijayan. He added that "minority communalism cannot defeat majoritarian communalism" and only a "people's movement can bring down this divide".

276.title: Lloris 9th senior French player to be injured ahead of Nations League games
276.article_body: Captain Hugo Lloris and defender Theo Hernandez are injured ahead of France's Nations League games against Austria and Denmark. Hernandez has a torn right adductor while Lloris suffered a right thigh injury, becoming the eighth and ninth senior French players to be injured. Goalkeeper Alban Lafont and Lucas Digne have been called in as replacements for the injured duo.

277.title: FIFA President Infantino might visit India in Oct and meet PM Modi: Reports
277.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino might visit India in October and call on PM Narendra Modi to discuss the way forward for Indian football, as per reports. Infantino's visit might coincide with final leg of the FIFA Women's U-17 World Cup to be held in India. An AIFF statement said if the meeting takes place, then "path-breaking" announcements can be expected.

278.title: Pakistan launch jersey for T20 World Cup 2022, share pics
278.article_body: Pakistan on Monday launched their jersey for T20 World Cup 2022. The kit features different shades of green colour, with yellow stripes being added to the shirt as a new design. The logo of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) can be seen printed on the top left side of the jersey. The PCB has named the jersey 'Thunder Jersey'.

279.title: Steve Smith one of the best players to ever play the game: Finch
279.article_body: Australia's T20 skipper Aaron Finch said that batter Steve Smith is "one of the best players that has ever played the game over all formats of the game". "We know the quality that Steve's got...So we know the skill that he has got and the game sense and the tactical nous that he has got," Finch said.

280.title: Man Utd launch probe after 12 players, staff fell ill on same day: Reports
280.article_body: Manchester United have reportedly launched an investigation after 12 of their first-team players and staff fell ill on the same day. Reports say club members fell ill with suspected food poisoning following their 2-0 away victory over FC Sheriff in the Europa League. The club is investigating if it was something they ate in Moldova or on the plane back.

281.title: Why can't I associate with RSS? Is it banned?: Kerala Governor Khan
281.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan asked why he cannot have relations with the RSS, an outfit he has been associated with since 1986. "Is RSS a banned organisation?" asked Khan, stating it supported him in the Shah Bano case. Khan had met RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, inviting criticism from the CPI(M) which said the Governor was doing the RSS' bidding.

282.title: 2 tigers found dead in Madhya Pradesh; carcass, hide recovered
282.article_body: As many as two tigers were lost in Madhya Pradesh. According to the officials, a carcass and a hide have been found in Bandhavgarh and Kanha reserves, respectively. The hide of a one-and-half-year-old tiger was recovered from Baihar forest adjoining Kanha Tiger Reserve while the carcass of an 11-year-old tigress was found in the Ghoda Deman area of BTR.

283.title: Sunil Chhetri shares pic with wife and trophies after Durand Cup victory
283.article_body: Bengaluru FC captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to share picture with his wife Sonam Bhattacherjee and trophies after winning Durand Cup. Saying that he wanted to win the tournament with Bengaluru, he wrote, "Durand Cup Champions...would have been a shame if an Army kid playing football professionally never had the chance to say this."

284.title: Secondary market ticket rate for Federer's last tournament jumps to ₹50 lakh: Reports
284.article_body: The secondary market ticket rate for Roger Federer's last tournament, Laver Cup, has risen to £59,000 (more than ₹50 lakh), The Sunday Times reported. "This is people re-selling their tickets, trying to make money off of Roger's retirement & the presence of the Big 4," a fan tweeted. However, Federer's participation at the marquee event is still doubtful.

285.title: Temple showing UP CM as Lord Ram incarnate built near Ayodhya
285.article_body: A temple has been built for CM Yogi Adityanath in UP's Maurya ka Purwa village, which is 15 km from Ayodhya, showcasing him as an "incarnation of Lord Ram". "Yogi Adityanath built the Ram temple for us and I have built this temple for him," said the temple's maker and pujari. He added that an 'aarti' is performed every evening.

286.title: Why was a stick broken and placed on Queen Elizabeth's coffin?
286.article_body: A thin, white stick was broken by the senior-most official of the royal household and placed on Queen Elizabeth's coffin before it was lowered into the royal vault. The 'Wand of Office' is a ceremonial tool of the Lord Chamberlain, once used to 'discipline' people in the monarch's court. Its breaking signifies the end of his service to the monarch.

287.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra's usefulness for Rahul can't be denied: Pawar
287.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar said that he couldn't deny the "usefulness" of the Bharat Jodo Yatra for Rahul Gandhi and the Congress party. Pawar said that foot marches like the Yatra have a political impact. He added that he wasn't opposed to Congress' inclusion in Opposition unity for the 2024 elections if it were to take shape.

288.title: UK's think tank launches world's 1st public database on fossil fuels
288.article_body: UK-based nonprofit think tank Carbon Tracker and Global Energy Monitor have launched the world’s first database for tracking the world's fossil fuel production, reserves and emissions. The database, named the Global Registry of Fossils Fuels, reportedly includes data from more than 50,000 oil, gas and coal fields in 89 countries, covering 75% of global reserves, production and emissions.

289.title: If BCCI Prez is endorsing fantasy leagues, you can’t expect players not to do it: Gambhir
289.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said if BCCI President is endorsing fantasy leagues, one can't expect players not to do it. "If he says that no one should be allowed to do it, I think everyone should follow that...It has to come from the top," he added. "Either we should ban this completely in India. It can’t be statewise," Gambhir stated.

290.title: Great start to the series: Mandhana after India's win vs England in 1st ODI
290.article_body: Following India Women's seven-wicket win against England Women in first ODI, India opener Smriti Mandhana tweeted, "Great start to the ODI series. Let's keep the momentum going. A total team effort." She added, "Great job Jhulan Goswami, Yastika Bhatia, Harmanpreet Kaur and Deepti Sharma." Mandhana was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for her 91 runs off 99 balls.

291.title: He has experienced that all around world already: Finch on Tim David
291.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch commented on batter Tim David who is likely to make his debut in the series against India starting on Tuesday. "Being an overseas player [in franchise cricket] has its challenges...because the expectations are high...So the fact that Tim has experienced that all around the world already...that prepares you as well...for international cricket," Finch said.

292.title: 3 men arrested for gang rape and murder of tribal woman in Andhra
292.article_body: In Andhra Pradesh, three men were arrested for the gang rape and murder of a 46-year-old tribal woman, who was an ASHA worker. The three accused men, identified as Anji, Chinna Anji and Paiswamy, had promised to help the woman locate her missing phone. Palnadu SP Ravi Sankara Reddy said that the men were inebriated and raped the woman.

293.title: 2 drown amid heavy rains in Nainital district
293.article_body: Two individuals died after drowning in separate incidents amid heavy rains in Uttarakhand's Nainital district over the past 24 hours, news agency PTI reported on Monday. One of the individuals reportedly drowned while crossing a flooded stream near Haldwani. Another drowning victim was identified as a boatman who died after falling into a lake on Sunday, as per PTI.

294.title: Ex-SP MLA Kishore Samrite held for threatening to bomb Parliament
294.article_body: Kishore Samrite, a former Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA from Madhya Pradesh's Lanji Assembly constituency, was arrested by Delhi Police's Crime Branch for allegedly threatening to blow up the Parliament with a bomb. Police said Samrite had sent a package to the Parliament, containing a letter, some flags, a copy of the Constitution and some gelatin sticks.

295.title: Farhan planned to bring SRK, Big B, Ranveer together in Don 3: Report
295.article_body: Farhan Akhtar reportedly planned to bring Shah Rukh Khan, Amitabh Bachchan and Ranveer Singh together for the film 'Don 3'. A source stated Ranveer was to have a cameo in the film. "The idea was that SRK's Don character would pass the baton to Ranveer...so that he can take on the iconic role in the future parts," the source added.

296.title: India, Saudi Arabia discuss Rupee-Riyal trade, introduction of UPI system
296.article_body: During the visit of Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal to Riyadh, the two countries held discussions on the feasibility of institutionalising Rupee-Riyal trade and introducing UPI and Rupay cards in Saudi Arabia. The Commerce Ministry said that the two countries also discussed the removal of trade barriers. Goyal and Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman Al Saud also discussed other issues.

297.title: Best way to keep them quiet is to keep working hard: Dulquer on trolls
297.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan opened up about how he deals with trolls and said that the best way to keep them quiet is to keep working hard. "But there are days when it's hurtful and days when it affects you but like any of us, we cannot dwell on it for too long, we keep on moving forward," Dulquer further said.

298.title: PM Modi congratulates wrestlers Vinesh, Bajrang on World C'ships bronze medals
298.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia on winning bronze medals at World Wrestling Championships 2022 and wrote, "Our wrestlers make us proud." He added, "This is special for both as Vinesh becomes the first Indian woman to win two medals on this platform and Bajrang wins his fourth medal."

299.title: I don't believe PM Modi is misusing CBI, ED: Mamata Banerjee
299.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she does not believe that PM Narendra Modi is misusing central agencies such as the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED). She alleged that "some BJP leaders are doing this for their interests". A resolution was passed in the state Assembly against the alleged excessive interference of central agencies.

300.title: The film is all about love which is beyond one's life: Jackie on 'Atithi...'
300.article_body: Veteran actor Jackie Shroff, speaking about his upcoming movie 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava', said, "The film is all about love which is beyond one's life." He added that the feeling of love has been expressed in a beautiful and sensitive way in the film. Directed by Hardik Gajjar, 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava' will also feature Pratik Gandhi and Sharmin Segal.

301.title: MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt visits Palampur military station
301.article_body: Union Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt visited the Palampur military station in Himachal Pradesh on Monday where he interacted with personnel of the Indian Army's Dah Division, officials said. The minister was briefed on operational preparedness, PRO (Defence) Jammu informed. Bhatt was also briefed on various innovations by units of the Dah Division, the official added.

302.title: Fraudster abused me when I told him I was in 'Jamtara': Amit Sial
302.article_body: Actor Amit Sial revealed that his mother was almost scammed after a fraudster asked her for a "UPI number" over an airline refund. Amit further stated, "I took the phone...I asked him if he had seen 'Jamtara', he said yes, I told him I have acted in it." He said the fraudster then abused him and disconnected the call.

303.title: I'm over 'who wore it better' collages: Janhvi on equation with Sara, Ananya
303.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about her equation with her contemporaries Ananya Panday, Sara Ali Khan and Tara Sutaria, said it's one of mutual respect. "At this point, we are just over...stupid 'who wore it better' collages, or...who's doing what," she added. Janhvi further said though there's "an element of insecurity" in all of them, they're very confident about their individual personalities.

304.title: Ukrainian shelling kills 13 in Donetsk, Pro-Russia officials say
304.article_body: At least 13 civilians were killed in shelling by Ukrainian forces in the city of Donetsk, its pro-Russia authorities claimed on Monday. "The number of people injured is being determined," the city's Moscow-backed mayor stated. Donetsk city is the administrative centre of Ukraine's breakaway Donetsk region. The region has been partially under the control of Moscow-backed separatists since 2014.

305.title: Want to entertain fans once again with batting: Gujarat Giants skipper Sehwag
305.article_body: Talking about playing in Legends League Cricket, Gujarat Giants skipper Virender Sehwag said he would try to entertain his fans once again with his batting after getting an opportunity to return to the cricketing field. "And I hope our team keeps playing well...wins the trophy," he added. Legends League Cricket is a global league with ex-cricketers playing competitive cricket.

306.title: Not 1 type of weaponry bought for defence forces under UPA: Amarinder Singh
306.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said "not even one type of weapon was ever purchased for Army, Navy or Air Force" under UPA government. "Now, weaponry is coming, which is necessary for us if we are to secure our nation," Singh said. He added that Congress is responsible for China being ahead of India in weaponry.

307.title: PM Modi to address meeting of all BJP mayors tomorrow
307.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will address a meeting of all BJP mayors at 10.30 am on Tuesday. "With growing urbanisation, it is important that we view it as an opportunity and work together towards building modern [and] futuristic cities," he said. PM Modi will virtually inaugurate the National Mayors' Conference on Tuesday morning in Gujarat's Gandhinagar.

308.title: 3 workers die after inhaling toxic gas inside illegal Assam coal mine
308.article_body: Three workers of an illegal coal mine located in Lido in Assam's Tinsukia district died on Sunday night after allegedly inhaling toxic gas, police said. So far, five persons have been arrested following the incident, according to police. "The 'rat hole' mine was being run illegally on a hill top," Tinsukia SP Debojit Deuri said.

309.title: Couple found hanging in a forest in Odisha's Kandhamal
309.article_body: A 45-year-old man and his wife were found hanging from separate trees in a forest in Odisha's Kandhamal district on Monday. The deceased, Monoranjan Nayak and Smitanjali, were residents of nearby Paburia village and might have died by suicide over some family dispute, police said. Notably, Nayak and his wife worked as Gaon Sathi and ASHA worker respectively.

310.title: Entry of devotees into sanctum sanctorum in Kedarnath Temple banned
310.article_body: The entry of devotees into the sanctum sanctorum of Kedarnath Temple in Uttarakhand has been banned for the time being in view of a huge rush of pilgrims. Devotees cannot go beyond the 'sabha mandap' for darshan till the ban is in force, Shri Badarinath Kedarnath Temple Committee said. The restriction can be removed only when the crowd gets smaller.

311.title: SBI asks exporters to trade with Bangladesh in rupee, taka: Report
311.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) asked exporters to avoid trading with Bangladesh using the dollar and instead use rupee or taka, Reuters reported. SBI is looking to protect Bangladesh's declining foreign reserves which have fallen from $48 billion a year earlier to $37 billion. Bangladesh Commerce Minister Tipu Munshi had said they want to cut dependency on the dollar.

312.title: Himachal to spend ₹3 crore to build quarters for govt employees: CM Thakur
312.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said that the state government will spend ₹3 crore to build residential accommodations for Class III and IV employees in the state's Kangra district. "The state government has cleared and fulfilled various dues and demands of the government officers," CM Thakur said. He added that the government is committed towards the welfare of its employees.

313.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin lowered into royal vault ahead of burial, pic surfaces
313.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's coffin has been lowered into the royal vault inside St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle in Berkshire, UK. She will be buried later in a private family service. The Queen will be laid to rest near her late husband Prince Philip, sister Princess Margaret and parents King George VI and Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother.

314.title: I don't agree with Akshay Kumar but I don't want his films to flop: Swara
314.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that Bollywood should not make itself a platform for propaganda. She added Bollywood is not a tangible and homogenous entity. Swara stated, "There could never be one voice coming out of the industry...I don't agree with Akshay Kumar because of the kind of films he supports...that doesn't mean I want his films to flop."

315.title: Hurricane Fiona hits Dominican Republic after Puerto Rico
315.article_body: Hurricane Fiona made landfall in the Dominican Republic early on Monday. The storm is predicted to unleash as much as 15 inches of rain in the eastern part of the Caribbean nation. Earlier on Sunday, Fiona struck Puerto Rico, causing a power outage that has affected over 1.4 million people. There were no immediate reports of deaths.

316.title: NARCL plans to buy 18 distressed accounts with ₹39,921cr debt: Report
316.article_body: National Asset Reconstruction Company of India Ltd is planning to acquire 18 distressed accounts with ₹39,921 crore debt by October 31, a report said. NARCL has reportedly created two lists, with phase one having eight accounts with ₹16,744 debt and phase two having 10 accounts with ₹18,177 debt. Jaypee Infrastructure and Meenakshi Energy are among the companies in phase one.

317.title: Actor Kartik Aaryan flies economy class, video from inside the plane goes viral
317.article_body: A video of actor Kartik Aaryan flying economy class has gone viral. In the video, co-passengers can be seen cheering for him and taking photographs with him. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Very humble and down to earth person." Other comments read, "Yeh hai real actor," and "Most humble star in Bollywood who feels proud to be among...people."

318.title: TSSC opens Centre of Excellence in partnership with Huawei in Patna
318.article_body: Telecom Sector Skill Council (TSSC), a skill development institution for the telecom industry, has opened a 'Centre of Excellence' (CoE) at NIT Patna in collaboration with Huawei Technologies. TSSC said the CoE will cater to roles in information and communications technology, cybersecurity, electronics and communication. Former Telecom and IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad inaugurated the centre.

319.title: Volkswagen sets price range for Porsche IPO, to raise up to $9.4 bn
319.article_body: Volkswagen has set a price range for the IPO of luxury sports car maker Porsche AG. The price range per preferred share was set at 76.50 euros to 82.50 euros which would result in proceeds of 8.71 billion to 9.39 billion euros. Porsche's share capital has been divided into 50% preferred and 50% ordinary shares.

320.title: George V metro station in Paris renamed 'Elizabeth II' for a day
320.article_body: A station on the Paris metro rail network named after Queen Elizabeth II's grandfather was renamed out of respect for the late Queen on her funeral day, Paris's public transit authority informed on Monday. The George V station was renamed "Elizabeth II". Signs at the station were replaced as part of the change that is to remain for a day.

321.title: Govt plans to sell 2 Air India subsidiaries by end-FY23: Report
321.article_body: The government is planning to privatise Air India's (AI) ground handling and engineering services by the end of FY23, according to reports. Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) has already started conducting roadshows with potential buyers to sell AI Airport Services and AI Engineering Services. Adani Group, Tata Sons and Swissport are reportedly interested in the offer.

322.title: Gabriel Jesus is the game-changer for Arsenal: Alan Shearer
322.article_body: Praising Gabriel Jesus, ex-Newcastle United player Alan Shearer said the striker is the "game-changer" for Arsenal, adding he sets the tone from the front. "Defenders hate players who are prepared to run in behind, he does that. He's the one who starts the press," he further said. Jesus has scored four goals in seven league matches in the season.

323.title: Meghan Markle breaks down in tears at Queen Elizabeth's funeral
323.article_body: The Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle broke down in tears during Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral at Westminster Abbey on Monday. Pictures showed her wiping away tears as she attended the Queen's funeral with other royals alongside her husband, Prince Harry. Markle broke down in tears as the Queen's coffin was transferred into a hearse at Wellington Arch.

324.title: Till today she says 'I was the one who discovered you': Madhur on Tabu
324.article_body: Director Madhur Bhandarkar said in an interview that actress Tabu is one of the main reasons why he is still working today. "Tabu believed in me. Till today she says 'I was the one who discovered you', and really, I have to give it to her," he added. "She worked with me knowing...I had a flop behind me," said Madhur.

325.title: ECB looking to offer James Anderson and Stuart Broad player-coach role: Reports
325.article_body: The ECB is reportedly devising a plan wherein pace bowlers James Anderson and Stuart Broad could be made player-coaches. Test coach Brendon McCullum is looking to streamline the support staff and might let the two pacers groom their successors, said the report. ECB may reportedly leave one of the pacers out in future Tests and assign them to oversee practice.

326.title: Alonso gave people €1,500 to support him over Hamilton: Ex-McLaren staffer
326.article_body: A former McLaren mechanic has revealed that Fernando Alonso had used financial incentives to lure people to his side of the team while he was teammates with Lewis Hamilton. Alonso is said to have handed envelopes with cash worth approximately €1,500 to incentivise all members to support him. The team bosses later made everyone give the money to charity.

327.title: It is going to be memorable playing in front of Pakistani crowds: Moeen
327.article_body: Ahead of England's upcoming tour to Pakistan for the first time in 17 years, English all-rounder Moeen Ali said that "it is going to be memorable playing in front of the Pakistani crowds". "An immense honour to deputize for Jos Buttler...and captain England," Moeen said. The 35-year-old cricketer added, "Seven T20Is will be a stern test in these (Pakistan) conditions."

328.title: Unmanned excavator removes 4,700 tonnes of silt from Chennai's waterways
328.article_body: Over 4,700 tonnes of silt and hyacinth were removed from Chennai's waterways using an unmanned robotic excavator, the Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) said. Nearly 25 streams and canals, including those in Trustpuram, Virugambakkam and Teynampet, have been cleared. "We're tirelessly working towards clearing all the drains and waterways...before the monsoon arrives," a senior GCC official said.

329.title: Sad to hear this news: Karanvir on TV actress Nishi Singh's death
329.article_body: Actor Karanvir Bohra took to Instagram Stories and mourned the demise of TV actress Nishi Singh. Karanvir shared a post related to Nishi's death and wrote, "Sad to hear this news." Nishi had appeared in TV shows like 'Ishqbaaz', 'Qubool Hai' and 'Tenali Rama'. She had suffered three strokes of paralysis in the last few years.

330.title: Heard Medvedev say he felt pressure of being no. 1, I haven't felt it: Alcaraz
330.article_body: US Open champion Carlos Alcaraz said he hasn't felt any pressure since becoming world number one last week. "I heard Daniil Medvedev say that he felt the pressure of being number one, that he thought it was going to be easier," he added. "In my case, maybe it's because I've played...Davis Cup had...warmth of all the people," he further said.

331.title: I'm not in that dumb race: Agnihotri on reports of 'Brahmāstra' beating 'The Kashmir...'
331.article_body: Reacting to reports saying 'Brahmāstra' beat 'The Kashmir Files' in box office, 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Hahaha...I don't know how did they beat #TheKashmirFiles...with sticks, rods, hockey...or AK47 or stones...Or with paid PR and influencers?" He added, "Let Bollywood films compete with each other. Leave us alone. I am not in that dumb race. Thanks. #NotBollywood."

332.title: Kangana shares childhood pics, says relatives called her Indira Gandhi
332.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has revealed that her relatives used to call her Indira Gandhi when she was a child. Sharing throwback pictures from her childhood on Instagram Stories, she wrote, "I didn't follow anyone's hairstyle as a kid." Kangana added, "I went to...village barber...and guided him to do [the] haircut...I liked, and I always liked it short...this inspired many jokes in...family."

333.title: J&K notifies holiday on Maharaja Hari Singh's birth anniversary on Sept 23
333.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has notified late Maharaja Hari Singh's birth anniversary on September 23 as a holiday. A notification issued on Monday stated that all government offices and educational institutes across the Union Territory will observe the holiday every year. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha earlier said that the holiday is a tribute to the Maharaja's services.

334.title: Women beat man with belts, tear his shirt outside Raipur airport; video surfaces
334.article_body: A video showing a group of women beating a man with belts, slapping him repeatedly and tearing his shirt in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, has surfaced online. The video was recorded outside Raipur airport and reports have said that both the parties have filed police complaints against each other. The scuffle reportedly broke out over a monetary dispute.

335.title: India to collaborate in 41 business areas with Saudi Arabia: Report
335.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Monday met Saudi Energy Minister Abdulaziz bin Salman Al Saud. He co-chaired a meeting with him wherein the nations reportedly agreed to collaborate in 41 business areas of agriculture and food security, energy, technology and IT and industry and infrastructure. Goyal participated in a CEO Roundtable with Saudi Arabia's prominent businessmen.

336.title: 16-year-old Dalit girl who was gang-raped & set afire in UP dies
336.article_body: A Dalit girl, who was set on fire after being gang-raped by two men in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit district on September 7, succumbed to her injuries on Monday while undergoing treatment. "The 16-year-old had suffered 68% burn injuries," King George's Medical University's spokesperson said. The two suspects in the case have been arrested and sent to judicial custody.

337.title: I think it'll be Cummins: Ponting on his pick for Aus' next ODI captain
337.article_body: Predicting Australia's next ODI captain following Aaron Finch's ODI retirement, Ricky Ponting said, "I think it'll be Pat Cummins, to be honest."  He added, "I know he doesn't play all...ODIs for obvious reasons, because his workload in Test cricket has been...very high in...last few years. I'll be surprised if it wasn't Cummins." Cummins is currently the Test captain of Australia.

338.title: Pak court quashes terror charges against former PM Imran Khan
338.article_body: The Islamabad High Court on Monday quashed terror-related charges against Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan in a case where he is accused of issuing threats against a female judge. During a rally last month, Khan had allegedly warned the judge of dire consequences for remanding his top aide Shahbaz Gill to 48-hour police custody in a sedition case.

339.title: Brahmāstra becomes second Bollywood film to earn ₹200 crore in India in 2022
339.article_body: Ayan Mukerji-directorial 'Brahmāstra' crossed the ₹200-crore mark in 10 days of its release. With this, it became the second Bollywood film to earn ₹200 crore domestically in 2022 after Vivek Agnihotri-directorial 'The Kashmir Files'. 'Brahmāstra' stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. 'The Kashmir Files' raked in more than ₹250 crore at the domestic box office.

340.title: Hindu-Muslim clashes break out in UK city after India-Pak match, 15 arrested
340.article_body: Large-scale unrest has been reported in UK's Leicester over the past few days, with groups from Hindu and Muslim communities clashing on the streets. Tension was first reported on August 28, the day of the India-Pakistan Asia Cup T20 cricket match. At least 15 people have been arrested following the violent clashes reported over the weekend, police said.

341.title: Working towards how I can improve as an opening batter: KL Rahul
341.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against Australia, KL Rahul said he's working on how he can improve as an opening batter and give more impact to the Indian team. In the recently concluded Asia Cup, the 30-year-old scored 132 runs in five matches at an average of 26.40. The first T20I will be played in Mohali on Tuesday.

342.title: Ambuja's shares at all-time high after being acquired by Adani Group
342.article_body: Shares of Ambuja Cements hit an all-time high on Monday after being acquired by the billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group. The cement maker's shares jumped nearly 10% to ₹568 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Notably, with the completion of the acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC, Adani Group has now become the country's second-largest cement player.

343.title: Wasim Jaffer names his India playing XI for first T20I against Australia
343.article_body: Former Team India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to name his Team India playing XI for the first T20I against Australia. He included KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma as openers, followed by Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya. He chose Dinesh Karthik over Rishabh Pant in his XI. The first T20I will take place on Tuesday in Mohali.

344.title: Took about 6 months, 3 teachers to get 'Thank God' song right: Yohani
344.article_body: Sri Lankan singer Yohani, speaking about learning Hindi for her song 'Manike' in 'Thank God', has said that it took her too long. "It took about six months...three teachers just to get one song so I'm not too sure how I am going to get the rest of it," she added. However, Yohani added that she enjoyed the process.

345.title: Fairfax Group-backed Go Digit's IPO put in 'abeyance' by SEBI
345.article_body: The proposed initial share sale of the Fairfax Group-backed Go Digit has been put in 'abeyance' by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). Go Digit filed its preliminary IPO papers on August 16. The market regulator didn't disclose the reason and on its website said "issuance of observations (has been) kept in abeyance" about Go Digit's IPO.

346.title: He speaks about love without fear: Zafar after Arijit says 'I'll come to Pak'
346.article_body: Pakistani actor-singer Ali Zafar has said that singer Arijit Singh deserves praise for speaking about love fearlessly on the big stage. This comes after Arijit, who was performing in the US in May, told a Pakistani fan that he will be visiting the country soon. "I think Arijit is a beautiful human being and a singer," Ali said.

347.title: Sikh delegation ties 'Pagdi, offers 'Siropa' to PM Modi
347.article_body: A delegation from Gurdwara Bala Sahib met PM Narendra Modi on Monday during which he reiterated his government's commitment to continuously work for the welfare of the Sikh community. The Sikh delegation honoured PM Modi by tying a 'Pagdi' and offering a 'Siropa' to him. PM Modi thanked the delegation for their wishes and prayers for his well-being, officials said.

348.title: Audience will see an unfiltered side of me: Bhavana on her 'Koffee...' debut
348.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey, speaking about her debut on Karan Johar's chat show 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I am simply elated." She added that the audience will get to see "a more flamboyant, unfiltered side" of her on the show. Bhavana is the wife of actor Chunky Panday and mother of actress Ananya Panday.

349.title: Zoom's flaws let hackers join meetings stealthily, update immediately: CERT-In
