349.article_body: Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has asked users to immediately update Zoom as its security flaws may let hackers join a meeting stealthily. Hackers may also get access to confidential information shared during Zoom meetings as their name won't be visible to other participants, CERT-In said. "These vulnerabilities exist due to improper access control implementation," it added.

350.title: Centre asks Google to take stringent steps to curb illegal lending apps: Report
350.article_body: Google has been asked by Centre to introduce more stringent checks to help curb use of illegal digital lending applications in India, Reuters reported. Google has been called to meetings several times in last few months by RBI and Centre to urge it to introduce tougher checks. "We've removed over 2,000 personal loan apps...from Play Store," a Google spokesperson said.

351.title: This is a party working in India's interest: Amarinder on joining BJP
351.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh after joining BJP on Monday said this is a party working in the interest of the country. "I thank the leadership of BJP for welcoming us. I discussed it with all my party members and we decided to do this," Singh said. He also merged his newly-formed Punjab Lok Congress (PLC) with BJP.

352.title: Allahabad University student leader tries to self-immolate over fee hike
352.article_body: A student leader of Allahabad University allegedly tried to immolate himself on Monday, amid the ongoing protest by students against fee hike for various courses in the 2022-23 academic year. Police, who were present on the spot, stopped him from immolating himself. The incident was followed by a clash between the police and the protesting students.

353.title: Spanish tourist bitten by monkeys while taking photos at Taj Mahal
353.article_body: A female tourist from Spain was on Monday bitten by monkeys on the Taj Mahal premises in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. As per reports, the woman was attacked when she was trying to take photographs of the monument. A video showing the woman getting first aid treatment has surfaced on social media.

354.title: BJP-ED-CBI alliance will contest Guj Assembly, Delhi civic polls: AAP
354.article_body: AAP National Spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj on Monday said an alliance of BJP, ED and CBI will be contesting Gujarat's Assembly polls and Delhi's civic body polls. "Meaning of ED calling [AAP leader] Durgesh Pathak is clear - [Delhi's civic body polls] are going to take place," Bharadwaj said. Pathak was called for questioning in relation with Delhi's excise policy scam.

355.title: Dish TV shares up 10% as Chairman Jawahar Goel resigns from board
355.article_body: Direct-to-Home operator Dish TV on Monday said that its Chairman Jawahar Lal Goel has resigned from his position. "Jawahar Lal Goel...has tendered his resignation from the company's board of directors and committee/s thereof with effect from the close of business hours of September 19," Dish TV said in a regulatory filing. The company's shares surged nearly 10% following the announcement.

356.title: She's beautiful inside out: Trisha on 'Ponniyin...' co-star Aishwarya
356.article_body: Actress Trisha, sharing her experience of working with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan', said she and Aishwarya shared a warm and comfortable vibe on the sets. "There were times when Mani sir would come and say, 'Stop talking, I can't have this camaraderie for my scene'," she added. "She's beautiful inside and out," Trisha further said.

357.title: It's conceptualised as trilogy: Alia on Dimple's role in 'Brahmastra'
357.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said director Ayan Mukerji has a larger thought for every character that featured in 'Brahmastra: Part One - Shiva'. She stated, "It's conceptualised as a trilogy...people have asked me about Dimple Kapadia you have seen her for 2.5 seconds but why and how?" Alia added, "You can always think...the makers...have something in mind for every character."

358.title: 3 accused in Chandigarh University video leak case sent to 7-day police remand
358.article_body: A court in Punjab's Mohali sent the three accused arrested over the alleged leak of videos of girls at Chandigarh University to seven-day police remand. Police have arrested the accused woman, but said she only sent her own video to her boyfriend in Shimla, who was also arrested on Sunday. Another man was arrested from Himachal Pradesh in this case.

359.title: Mob vandalises temple & removes saffron flag in UK, India condemns incident
359.article_body: The Indian High Commission in the UK has 'strongly condemned' the incident wherein a temple was vandalised by a mob in Leicester and a saffron flag erected there was removed. "We've strongly taken up this matter with the UK authorities and...sought immediate action against those involved in the attack," it said. Videos showing the attack have gone viral on Twitter.

360.title: Raj BJP MLA brings a cow to Vidhan Sabha over spread of lumpy skin disease
360.article_body: BJP MLA from Rajasthan's Pushkar, Suresh Singh Rawat, brought a cow to the state's Assembly premises on Monday to draw attention towards the spread of lumpy skin disease. Cows are suffering but the state government is in a deep slumber, Rawat said. The cow later went out of control due to excessive noise while Rawat talked to reporters.

361.title: Dropouts-turned-founders like Kamath are exceptionally brilliant people: Ashneer
361.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover said college dropouts who went on to start their own companies, like Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath, are "exceptionally brilliant people". "[Those dropouts] felt like the formal education process is a waste of their time. They felt they can learn quicker than that education process. And those people have gone and built exceptional businesses," Grover added.

362.title: James promised acting won't be overshadowed by technology in Avatar: Sam
362.article_body: Actor Sam Worthington revealed that director James Cameron promised him that his acting in 'Avatar' will not be overshadowed by technology. "It was the truth. And that was the promise that he made me, and that's what came out...It was just there. And that's the essence that I saw," Sam added. Sam will feature in 'Avatar: The Way of Water'.

363.title: Yati Narsinghanand, 2 others booked for hate speech in UP's Aligarh
363.article_body: Yati Narsinghanand, head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, along with two others, have been booked for allegedly making inflammatory statements against a particular community, police said on Monday. The accused, including an Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha functionary and her husband, allegedly made the statements during a religious programme held in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on Sunday night.

364.title: ED files chargesheet against Partha, his aide in recruitment scam
364.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday submitted a chargesheet before a special court against former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. They both were arrested by the ED on July 23. As per the chargesheet, there are 43 witnesses in the case.

365.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
365.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Heavy rainfall is very likely over parts of Assam, Meghalaya and Madhya Pradesh till September 23. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha till September 21 and over Arunachal Pradesh on September 22 and 23. Andhra Pradesh and Telangana may witness heavy rainfall till September 21.

366.title: Gangster with 25 criminal cases shot dead outside court in Rajasthan
366.article_body: A gangster was shot dead by four-five unidentified assailants outside a court in Rajasthan's Nagaur when he was about to appear before the court on Monday. The gangster, Sandeep Sethi, came out of jail on bail last week. He had 25 criminal cases registered against him, a police officer said. The accused came on bikes and fired 9-10 rounds.

367.title: Man dies in Thane's Ulhasnagar after adjacent building's wall falls on him
367.article_body: A 60-year-old man was killed and his 58-year-old wife injured in Thane district's Ulhasnagar after a slab of a wall from an adjacent building collapsed on their roof on Sunday. The man, who recently celebrated his 38th wedding anniversary, was still in bed when the wall came falling through the roof. Municipal authorities said they'd recommended repairs to the building.

368.title: King Charles leaves a note on his mother Queen Elizabeth's coffin
368.article_body: King Charles III left a handwritten note on his mother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral at the Westminster Abbey, which read, "In loving and devoted memory. Charles R". The "R" in King Charles' title refers to "Rex," which means king in Latin. The wreath on the coffin included flowers cut from Buckingham Palace, Clarence House and Highgrove House.

369.title: Missed 'Dil Chahta Hai': Isha Koppikar on her biggest mistake in B'wood
369.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar, when asked to share the biggest mistake she made in her Bollywood career, said that she "missed" Aamir Khan, Saif Ali Khan and Akshaye Khanna-starrer 'Dil Chahta Hai'. She revealed that she was offered the role opposite Saif, which was eventually played by Sonali Kulkarni. "I [already] gave my dates to Pyaar Ishq Aur Mohabbat," said Isha.

370.title: Told Shoaib Malik to retire; knew that he'll not be respected: Hafeez
370.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Mohammad Hafeez said that all-rounder Shoaib Malik "gave his best" to the country for "about 21-22 years". "When I took my retirement, I told Malik to take retirement as well because I knew that he will not be respected," Hafeez said. Notably, 40-year-old Malik was overlooked by the selectors for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia.

371.title: Federer arrives in London for his final ATP tournament Laver Cup
371.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has arrived in London for his final ATP tournament, the Laver Cup. The 41-year-old recently announced that he will retire after the Laver Cup, scheduled to be held from September 23 to 25. Federer will play for Team Europe, which includes Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray, among others.

372.title: Mumbai Police ban cattle transportation stating lumpy skin disease
372.article_body: The Mumbai Police has prohibited the transportation of cattle in the city to prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease. Officials said the order, which came into effect on September 14, will remain in force till October 13. Other than cattle, transportation of fodder, grass or equipment which came in contact with lumpy skin disease-affected animals is also prohibited.

373.title: FTX may be operating in UK without authorisation: Britain's financial watchdog
373.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX may be offering financial services or products in the United Kingdom  without authorisation, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said on Friday. "This firm is not authorised by us and is targeting people in the UK," FCA said in a statement titled 'FTX'. Global rules are needed to regulate international crypto firms, FCA had said earlier.

374.title: Ghana declares end of Marburg virus outbreak
374.article_body: Ghanaian health authorities have declared the end of the recent Marburg virus outbreak that claimed three lives, Ghana's presidency informed on Monday. The outbreak of the highly infectious disease, which is similar to Ebola, was confirmed in July. This was the second Marburg virus outbreak in West Africa, following an outbreak in Guinea last year.

375.title: Told Ayan 'Won't do Brahmastra if it doesn't work for me': Nagarjuna
375.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna revealed filmmaker Ayan Mukerji offered him 'Brahmastra' in 2018. "When I was told Ayan wants me to play a role in his film, I said sure, but what am I going to be doing in a film like that? And I won't do it if it doesn't work for me," he stated. Nagarjuna played Anish Shetty in 'Brahmastra'.

376.title: I get things that are more 'maaro-todo', want something new: Sunny
376.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol, speaking about his image, said, "I wish they (filmmakers) would give me an opportunity to do something more than just scream." "I always want something new...but zyadatar (mostly) because of the commercial element, I get things that are more maaro-todo (hit and break)," he added. Sunny will be next seen in films like 'Chup' and 'Gadar 2'.

377.title: StartupXseed Ventures' Fund II closes at ₹243 crore
377.article_body: The second fund of early-stage venture capital firm StartupXseed Ventures was closed at ₹243 crore, oversubscribed by 20% compared to its initial target. StartupXseed was founded by BV Naidu (Former Director STPI) along with Mohandas Pai (through Aarin Capital), Ramakrishna V and Ravi Thakur. Fund II will invest between ₹5 - ₹12 crore in enterprise SaaS and deeptech startups.

378.title: Kidnappers pose as police to extort ₹11 lakh from B'luru real estate brokers
378.article_body: Five people allegedly kidnapped two real estate brokers from near the satellite bus stand on Mysuru Road in Bengaluru after posing as Telangana Police officers and extorted ₹11 lakh from them. The Bengaluru Police has arrested the accused. They kept the duo in a hotel room and asked for ₹50 lakh for letting them go.

379.title: 14-yr-old ends life after 'feeling rejected by female friend' in Mumbai
379.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 10 student died by suicide in Mumbai on Friday night after he felt rejected by a female friend, police said. The boy had chatted with a female friend who told him that they were just friends and that triggered the alleged suicide, Indian Express quoted police sources as saying. Police have registered a case of accidental death.

380.title: Can't rule out possibility of nuclear deal talks on UNGA sidelines: Iran
380.article_body: A meeting regarding the 2015 nuclear deal on the sidelines of this year's UN General Assembly is not entirely out of question, Iran's Foreign Ministry said on Monday. Tehran, however, dismissed the possibility of a bilateral meeting between Iranian and US officials. Iran is demanding the closure of an IAEA probe as a precondition for the pact's revival.

381.title: Pune city reports 39 cases of Swine Flu, 1 death in 7 days: Data
381.article_body: Pune Health Department has said the city has reported 39 cases of Swine Flu and one death due to the virus in the seven days between September 10-17. Dr Prachee Sathe from Ruby Hall Clinic said there're patients from all age groups who're admitted due to the disease. Pune has reported 909 Swine Flu cases and 40 deaths this year.

382.title: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh joins BJP
382.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh joined the Bharatiya Janata Party on Monday and merged his party, Punjab Lok Congress(PLC), with the BJP. Singh had floated Punjab Lok Congress after he had quit the Indian National Congress in 2021. He had earlier met BJP National President JP Nadda in Delhi.

383.title: Even if 'RRR' wins Oscar, won't change the way I work: SS Rajamouli
383.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli said his plans for his next film won't change even if he wins an Oscar for 'RRR' or not. "Oscar will be a real boost for morale for the (film's) unit...the country itself, but that's not going to change the way I work," he added. Rajamouli stated he wants to constantly keep upgrading himself as a filmmaker.

384.title: Ponting used to hit balls at 160 kmph speed with a cap on: Lee
384.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee narrated a 1994-95 incident about former skipper Ricky Ponting. "We had to face 12 balls at a 160 kmph off the bowling machine in the...nets," Lee said. "Well, the rumour is that...Ponting went there...with a cap on. Rod Marsh said 'what are you doing?' He said 'I'm batting'...Ponting goes bang...did not miss one," he added.

385.title: Yuvraj watches his 6 sixes in an over with son to mark 15th anniversary, shares video
385.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself and his seven-month-old son Orion watching his six sixes in an over. "Couldn’t have found a better partner to watch this together with after 15 years," Yuvraj wrote. Yuvraj slammed six sixes in an over off England's Stuart Broad in T20 World Cup on September 19, 2007.

386.title: Bombay HC denies bail to professor Hany Babu in Elgar Parishad case
386.article_body: The Bombay High Court has rejected the regular bail application of Delhi University professor and Elgar Parishad accused Hany Babu. Arrested in July 2020 from his home in Delhi, he is currently lodged in Mumbai's Taloja jail. The National Investigation Agency has accused Babu of a conspiracy to kill PM Narendra Modi, stating a letter was found on his computer.

387.title: Satellite spectrum auction will hinder rural broadband connectivity: Industry body chief
387.article_body: Telecom industry body ITU-APT Foundation of India (IAFI) President Bharat Bhatia said auctioning satellite spectrum will hinder growth of rural broadband connectivity in India. "If one operator buys [satellite spectrum], no one else can access and the satellite industry will not grow," Bhatia added. Allocating spectrum administratively rather than via auction is a better option, he further said.

388.title: Smart LED streetlights to be installed in every corner of Bengaluru
388.article_body: Bengaluru will see smart LED streetlights that are expected to reduce energy wastage as all sodium vapour lamps will be removed from the city streets. Eight zones will get the upgraded streetlights in another two months, officials said. As many as 4.85 lakh sodium vapour lamps will be replaced with LED lights.

389.title: We ran an experiment: YouTube after users claim watching 10 unskippable ads
389.article_body: A couple of months after some users claimed to see 10 unskippable advertisements during a single break, YouTube in a statement to 9to5Google confirmed that it ran a small experiment globally. YouTube said that it "served multiple ads in an ad pod when viewers watched longer videos on connected TVs". "We have concluded this small experiment," the company added.

390.title: Ranbir, Alia meet family of their bodyguard, latter calls it 'Family Astra'
390.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt recently met the family of their security consultant Yusuf Ibrahim. He took to his Instagram Stories to share photos of Alia and Ranbir as they posed with his family. Along with a photo, Yusuf wrote 'FamilyAstra' in reference to the couple's film 'Brahmastra', which was released on September 9.

391.title: SEBI invites EoIs for implementing new tool to boost social media surveillance
391.article_body: SEBI has invited expressions of interest (EoIs) to implement a 'Web Intelligence Tool' to boost surveillance of social media and other platforms. Publicly available data, a result of rising internet usage, has the potential to provide insights on topics related to various securities laws' violations, SEBI said. The tool should save time and gather unstructured, publicly available data, SEBI added.

392.title: Pimpri Chinchwad-based IT professional robbed, beaten up by 2 men
392.article_body: A 47-year-old Pimpri-Chinchwad-based IT professional was waylaid and robbed by two men on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway, police said. The victim was returning home when the accused started arguing with him, robbed him and beat him up. They hatched a fake accident plan and pretended that their mobile was broken in the incident, hence threatening and extorting money from the victim.

393.title: Delhi sees rise in dengue cases, reports 101 new infections last week
393.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 101 people were diagnosed with the infection in the last week alone. Delhi has reported 152 dengue cases so far in September, taking the national capital's total tally to nearly 400 so far this year, a report said. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

394.title: Kohli changed the focus of Team India when he became captain: Johnson
394.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Mitchell Johnson said that batter Virat Kohli changed the focus of the Indian team when he took on the captaincy. Kohli was named as India's all-format captain in 2017. Rohit Sharma replaced Kohli as limited-overs captain in December last year and as full-time Test captain in February this year.

395.title: 9 persons sentenced to life imprisonment in 11-yr-old Rohtak murder case
395.article_body: A local court in Haryana's Rohtak sentenced nine persons to life imprisonment in an 11-year-old murder case. They were convicted of killing a man, a resident of Rohtak and the court also fined each convict ₹20,000. On August 2, 2011, the man was killed with sticks and bricks, Sampla Police Station in-charge Rakesh Saini said.

396.title: Roma coach Jose Mourinho restrained, sent off after charging at referee
396.article_body: AS Roma manager Jose Mourinho was sent off during his team's match against Atalanta after he invaded the pitch to confront the referee. Mourinho had to be restrained by his own coaching staff and Serie A officials after Roma was not awarded a penalty. In February 2022, Mourinho was banned for two games after he acted in a "threatening" manner.

397.title: SEBI seeks details of PE, VC funds with 5 or less investors: Report
397.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has asked venture capital (VC) and private equity (PE) funds with five or fewer investors to disclose certain details, The Economic Times reported. This includes the investors' names, amount committed and funds raised. The market regulator also requested for details of investee companies, their countries of origin and nature of their business.

398.title: Tharoor meets Sonia Gandhi after endorsing 'constructive reforms' petition
398.article_body: Hours after endorsing a petition by younger members of the party seeking 'constructive reforms' in the Congress, MP Shashi Tharoor met UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi in Delhi today. "I welcome this petition that is being circulated by a group of young Congress members...It has gathered over 650 signatures so far. I am happy to endorse it," he said.

399.title: India gained ₹35,000 crore by importing discounted crude oil from Russia: Report
399.article_body: India reportedly gained ₹35,000 crore by importing discounted crude oil from Russia since the Ukraine conflict began in February. As per a report, India has emerged as the second-largest buyer of Russian oil after China. Russian oil accounts for 12% of the country's total oil purchase as compared to less than 1% before the war.

400.title: When a film premieres at TIFF, it's also taken seriously in India: Radhika
400.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan, who recently attended the premiere of her film 'Kacchey Limbu' at Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF), said that when a film is premiered on a platform like TIFF, it is also taken seriously in India. "It is not just another film," she added. Radhika further said 'Kacchey Limbu' addresses a very important topic.

401.title: Gambhir urges Indians to end hero worship, says 'Don't create monsters in dressing room'
401.article_body: Gautam Gambhir has urged Indians to end hero worship in cricket. "Don't create monsters in dressing room," he said. Gambhir noted when Virat Kohli slammed his 71st international hundred, Indians ignored Bhuvneshwar Kumar's five-wicket contribution in that match. He stated only Kapil Dev and MS Dhoni are credited for India's World Cup victories, adding, "We never bother about small contributions."

402.title: I'm a Balki fan now, 'Chup' is his best film: Mahesh Bhatt
402.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt shared Mahesh Bhatt's review of her upcoming film 'Chup'. As per the post, Mahesh Bhatt called 'Chup' a film that "has audacity and stands tall all alone". She mentioned that the filmmaker is now a fan of R Balki and called 'Chup' "his best film". The R Balki directorial also stars Sunny Deol and Dulquer Salmaan.

403.title: 71 international tons, that's ridiculous: Finch on Kohli ahead of 1st T20I
403.article_body: Ahead of India-Australia first T20I, Australia skipper Aaron Finch said it'll take a very brave man to write India batter Virat Kohli off. "At any stage, he has shown for 15 years now that he's one of the greatest players of all time...He's super and has 71 international centuries. That's just ridiculous," he added. Match will be played on Tuesday.
